title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
Care to Translate is an award-winning social impact company that develops digital translation tools for the healthcare sector. We solve the problem of language barriers by offering state of the art products that deliver safe and efficient communication between healthcare professionals and patients.
 



  





**Senior Software Engineer at Care to Translate** 




**Would you like to be part of building technology that tears down language barriers in health care? We are looking for a passionate developer who want to join our journey towards equal healthcare for all.** 




  





**The Product** 




 Our current solution consists of many different pieces, among them a content management system for our phrase library, a portal for our customers, API's to bring everything together, and of course our medical translation app that is available on ios, android and web. If you want to know more about how that looks, you can always test the free version by downloading it on 
 **google play** 
  or 
 **appstore** 
 .
 



 At the moment our products are mainly built in .net8 and typescript (react + react native), but we do have some projects built in python, node and java as well. Everything is hosted in Azure. We will keep working with the chosen languages, but are always open to learn new ways of developing and hosting the best possible solutions.
 



  





**The Position** 




 We are growing and want to find a software developer to help us in developing tomorrow's solutions to interpretation in health care. Our product team currently consists of two and a half full stack developers, one and a half product designer and a product strategist, as well as a coding CTO (sorry about all the halves, but it's not uncommon to have multiple roles at this company). You will help us face new challenges that comes with scaling up the company, and it can include anything from DevOps or technical infrastructure to app design fixes or feature development. Our latest app initiative is bringing AI translation technology to our app, and we have a lot of potential to explore.
 



  
 



 We believe that your passion, rather than a role description, should be a guidance in what you will focus on. Therefore we don't really care about what stack you have used before. We believe you can learn our stack and provide us with new ideas inspired by your previous experience or interests. The key thing we're looking for is someone who really wants to work in a product team, including every challenge and opportunity that comes with. With that said, you will have some benefits from knowing or being interested in some of the following:
 



  




* Modern C# and .NET
* React / react-native or similar frameworks
* Azure / cloud architecture and how to handle IT-security related decisions
* Azure DevOps / DevOps in general
* Building apps and services using modern AI technologies



  





 Since we're still a small company, you have a unique chance to affect the companies roadmap in a way that helps us benefit from your interests to the max as well as gaining insight into all aspects of running a business.
 



  





 There is also the possibility to grow into a role with more focus on leadership, as well as an opportunity to get shares in the company via Qualified Stock Options (sv. "Kvalificerade personaloptioner").
 



  
 



**Way of working** 




 We believe the best code is written together and we encourage working in pairs or mobs to have living discussions about all aspects of programming. That's also why we prefer to work on location, where it's easier for us to collaborate whenever needed without worrying about communication blocks.
 



 With that said, we understand that it's sometimes easier to work on your own, and we are flexible when it comes to setting up a way of working that suits everyone. A couple of days at the office and a couple of days at home is fine as long as we coordinate.
 



  





 We encourage new ideas, and always try to optimize our processes through retros, open channels for feedback and discussion and talking over a beer or two.
 



  





*Ps. You can send your application in Swedish or English :)*

title: Python Developer
description:
**The Team** 
 :
 



 The development team is based in Stockholm. It consists of highly skilled and helpful individuals with diverse backgrounds, each engineer playing a unique part in serving our global customer base. We value learning from and supporting each other in order to benefit from our different strengths and experiences. We are strong believers that collaboration is key to innovation and to produce a user experience and a technical solution that we can be proud of.
 



  





**The Impact:** 




 OSTTRA is a FinTech company at the heart of the global financial system, dedicated to building the future of post-trade processing. Our products within the Trade Lifecycle division cover many of these areas, such as portfolio reconciliation, risk calculations, collateral management, and settlement automation. Improving these systems has a real impact on reducing the systemic risk of the global financial market while boosting operational efficiency and producing cost savings for many of the largest banks in the world.
 



  





**What’s in it for you:** 



* Be part of an empowered, self-organising engineering team with people who will help you grow
* Be part of an innovative and inclusive company culture
* Impact the team’s strategy for architectural styles, ways of working, deployment pipelines, data locality strategies, observability metrics, frontend frameworks, and much, much more
* Expand your technical skill set by working in a modern tech stack (including e.g. Python, Elm, Kubernetes, relational and NoSQL databases)
* Help improve the environment and our society by contributing to our many social initiatives (optional)



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Actively contribute to the development and architecture of the system to meet new and changing business needs
* Uphold architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility
* Be part of the team taking care of the overall system health
* Mentor colleagues
* Understanding customer requirements/needs



  





**What We’re Looking For:** 



* 3-10 years of relevant experience
* An aptitude and willingness to improve yourself, others around you, and our ways of working
* Good communication skills
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment
* Someone who will work from the office at least 3 days per week



  





**We’d Also Prefer It if You Have:** 



* A master’s degree in computer science or a similar field
* An interest in financial markets



  





  





**About OSTTRA** 




  





*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.* 




  





 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
 



 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
 



 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
 



  





 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
 



  





**What’s In It For You?**




  





**Benefits:**




 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
 



  





 Our benefits include:
 


* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.



 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
 



  





 -----------------------------------------------------------
 



  





**Equal Opportunity Employer** 




 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
 







 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to:
 
 EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com
 
 and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.

title: Java Software Engineer
description:
**Job Description:** 




 We are looking for a skilled Java Developer with 5+ years of experience to design, develop, and maintain scalable microservices applications. The ideal candidate should have expertise in:
 



  





**Required Skills:** 



* **Tech Stack:** 
 Spring Boot, Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, Kafka, REST, Microservices
* **Tools:** 
 JUnit, Mockito, Maven, Git, Jenkins
* Strong understanding of microservices architecture and cloud solutions.



  





**Responsibilities:** 



* Develop Java-based applications and RESTful APIs.
* Deploy and manage services using Docker, Kubernetes, and AWS.
* Integrate Kafka for messaging and handle microservice interactions.
* Write unit and integration tests using JUnit and Mockito.
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines with Jenkins.

title: Fullstack / Frontend Developer - Planning and Solution Design
description:
10% of Europe’s CO₂ emissions are caused by residential heating and energy bills are out of control. Aira is here to change that.
   

  

 With our intelligent Aira Heat Pump at the heart, we’re making the switch to clean energy-tech easier and more affordable. Helping Europe turn off gas and slashing energy costs one home at a time.
   

  

 Founded in 2022, and with 1000+ employees and counting, Aira is driving the clean energy revolution by providing homes with modern clean energy-tech solutions such as solar power, battery storage solutions and heat pumps. With a state-of-the-art production facility in Poland, an HQ in Stockholm, Sweden, and hubs across the UK, Germany and Italy, Aira is well on track to install clean energy-tech into 5 million homes by 2034.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As a Fullstack Developer, you’ll play a central role in one of our product teams, within Aira’s Acquisition area. The focus of these teams is to craft web applications at the heart of Aira’s energy solution design and installation planning systems. These applications are fundamental to achieving a world-class customer experience and span across tools for designing the solutions, as well as planning and scheduling the installations. The team develops data products for modeling Aira's field force optimization as well as the tools to support installers on-site, at the customers' homes.
   

  

**What You Bring To The Team**
* Proficiency in frontend development, particularly with React & Typescript.
* Experience in automated testing to ensure application reliability and performance
* Experience writing backends in a classical object-oriented language like C# or Java


 We would also expect you to have experience in at least two of the following areas:
   

  

  

* Writing backend code in Java and Spring Boot
* Databases (e.g. DynamoDB/PostgreSQL)
* Event-driven architectures (Kafka)
* Cloud DevOps (AWS, Docker, Terraform, Kubernetes)
* gRPC and protobuf


**What is in it for you?**
* Gain hands-on experience in a fast-growing scale-up, with a supportive and inclusive culture, and career advancement opportunities.
* Collaborate with diverse teams across international markets and launch products globally.
* Develop and grow personally and professionally in an entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Thrive in a dynamic, solution-oriented culture, tackling challenges and driving meaningful solutions that make a positive impact on the world.
* Influence the company's success, with a visible impact on product development and market growth.
* Enjoy working in our brand new office. Conveniently located near public transport, with Sankt Eriksplan subway station just a few minutes walk away.


 Aira leads in the next generation of Energy. We are driven by our belief that the power of diversity fuels innovation. We welcome individuals from all backgrounds, cultures, and perspectives to join our team, united in our mission to create a better future for society and the planet.

title: Senior Web Developer
description:
At Umain, we're not just creating software; we're crafting the future, one innovative project at a time. With our motto "Shape, Ship, Scale," we empower our team to not only envision the future but also play a pivotal role in building it. We're a dynamic team where you can shape the future, ship groundbreaking solutions, and scale your abilities in many different ways.
   

  

 We're on the lookout for senior developers ready to join us in this journey, bringing passion, creativity, and dedication along with them. The role is relatively broad and focused on web technologies, where we offer the opportunity to work on many interesting projects on modern web stack technologies.
   

  

**What We Offer**
* A chance to work on unique projects that explore and push the boundaries of what's possible.
* A fun and fair work environment where your you have the opportunity to expand your skills through unique challenges and fantastic colleagues.
* A personal coach, and a setting where you can grow professionally and personally.
* Being part of multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile teams, being an important player in a highly ambitious setting.


 As a Senior Web Developer at Umain, your role will involve:
   

  

* Use modern frontend frameworks such as NextJS, Svelte, or Flutter to create amazing digital experiences.
* Engaging with backend languages and frameworks like Go, Rust, or Kotlin to craft scalable integration middle layers.
* Working with contemporary SaaS headless CMS and E-commerce platforms including Centra, Shopify, and MedusaJS.
* Participating in projects & teams alongside major brands and large organizations, and contributing to emerging tech trends and innovations.


**Who You Are**
* You're a developer with a passion for innovation and a knack for problem-solving.
* You're eager to learn, grow, and take on new challenges.
* You value collaboration, diversity, and the opportunity to make a significant impact.
* You believe in the power of technology to shape the future.
* You have worked professionally as a Web Developer for at least 5 years.


 Why Umain?
   

  

* Career Framework: We believe in fairness and clarity, which is why we've established a transparent career framework to ensure equal pay and equal opportunities for all. Your growth and success are as important to us as they are to you. Together with your coach, you will build your own development plan and grow in your career.
* Work-Life Balance: At Umain, diversity is our strength. We understand that life doesn’t pause when you walk into the office. That's why we've cultivated an environment that supports an excellent work-life balance. We welcome team members from all walks of life, recognizing the richness that different backgrounds, ages, and life stages bring to our team. We're committed to supporting each other, encouraging a healthy work-life balance that respects your needs, whether it's taking care of your family, your pets, or yourself.
* Innovations and Learning: Technology is always evolving, bringing new challenges and opportunities for collaboration and learning. Our developers work closely with designers, analysts, testers and more to tackle these challenges head-on, sharing knowledge and growing together.
* Skills Over Degrees: We’re more interested in what you can do than in the diplomas you hold. Talent, drive, and creativity are what count at Umain. Here, you’ll find opportunities to grow, learn, and excel in your career, regardless of your educational background. If you have the ambition and commitment to succeed, we have the environment and resources to support your journey.


**Are you ready to SHAPE, SHIP, and SCALE with us?**
 If you're a developer who thrives on innovation, values a supportive and inclusive workplace, and is eager to make a tangible impact on the future, we’d love to hear from you. Let’s build something awesome together.
   

  

 Umain is a digital product consultancy. We shape, ship and scale digital products at speed. Founded in Stockholm in 2001, we are a growing team of 100+ experts in digital product strategy, design, and technology.
   

  

 We are a part of Eidra, a group of top-notch companies specializing in strategy, creativity, and engineering. As a collective we guide leaders in making meaningful and lasting change.

title: Platform Developer
description:
**Doktor.se** 
 is looking for a Platform Developer to join our exciting growth journey. Our mission is to provide a platform to make digital and physical healthcare accessible and easier for everyone. We are creating a platform of services, tools, and processes to make it possible. We believe this mission is challenging but extremely exciting and fulfilling. We are looking for additional engineers to strengthen our “Platform Enablement” team!
   

  

**As an Platform Developer you'll enjoy**
 You will work with our infrastructure, monitoring, deployment tools and services for a secure, reliable, and highly available platform. Also, you develop automation toolings and preassembled configurations to make a better developer experience. You take the initiative and drive to evolve the platform's infrastructure to support our rapid business growth and compliance needs. You will collaborate on building a microservice-based system running on Kubernetes in AWS (Amazon Web Services). You will improve deployment automation following the principles for Infrastructure as Code and enhance platform monitoring and alerting to scale the platform. Like always, constant solidifying our security posture is job zero.
   

  

 You will work with our tech stack including but not limited to Terraform, Typescript, Python, Datadog, AWS, PostgreSQL, Kubernetes/EKS, Flux/GitOps, GitHub Actions.
   

  

**Qualifications And Personal Qualities**
* Curiosity, being analytic with a passion for problem-solving, and being a good communicator
* Some hands-on experience with Kubernetes and building CI/CD pipelines
* We are an international organization, so fluency in English is required


**We offer you**
 With us, you get a workplace to grow, phenomenal colleagues, and the opportunity to be part of a growing healthcare group with many points of contact. Together, we create a delightful team spirit, a strong sense of community, and a robust culture!
   

  

 We also offer you:
   

  

* Collective agreement
* Occupational pension
* Wellness allowance
* Breakfast every monday


**More practical details**
* The desired start is as soon as possible, but of course, we take into consideration your notice period and preferences
* The position is a permanent employment with an initial probationary period
* Your placement will be at Sveavägen 63, with the possibility to work from home fridays


 If this describes you, then you know what to do! We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

**Good luck!**
 På Doktor.Se vill vi göra saker annorlunda. Vi vill utmana och förändra en hel bransch. Allt började med en idé om att det måste gå att skapa en vårdlösning som är bättre anpassad till vår tid och våra behov. Att det måste gå att få moderna digitala verktyg och traditionell fysisk vård att samverka med utgångspunkt i patientens behov. Och att göra det så att det inte bara blir tillgängligt för våra patienter utan också bidrar till att utveckla det sätt som vård erbjuds på idag. För oss alla. Det här är faktiskt vad vi gör idag. Men vi är långt ifrån klara och är ute på en spännande förändringsresa. Där kan du få vara med och bidra.

title: Solution developer to Analytics & Reporting | SEB, Solna
description:
Take the next step in your career and elevate our Big Data solutions!
   

  

 As Solution Developer at SEB in Solna, you build large-scale Big Data solutions, processing streaming and batch data.
   

  

 Making data accessible is central to our business, and our work enables the delivery of our digital services to our customers. With us you make this possible, working with our modern tech stack and the Accounts and Payments data that is at the core of our business.
   

  

**About the role:**
 As a developer at SEB in Solna you develop and maintain complex Big Data solutions and data pipelines, enabling efficient and qualitative analyses and reporting of large-scale transactional data.
   

  

 You belong to a team of competent and highly motivated developers and Data Engineers, and together you solve complex problems, processing and streaming data from various sources into our big data platforms. Your competence and expertise are trusted to make big-picture decisions and given creative leeway.
   

  

 We use Hadoop for storing and processing data and Apache solutions such as Airflow for workflow management. We also use Apache Kafka, Spark and Hive for large-scale data processing, streaming and storage. Along with this we are establishing new pipelines using Google Cloud such as Dataflow using Java, Cloudfunctions, Google Pubsub, BigQuery and BigTable.
   

  

 In addition our team supports a set of container-based microservices and you will work with Kubernetes, OpenShift. We are working with Scala, Java and Spring Boot.
   

  

**Your team:**
* You will work with in Analytics and Reporting in Solna, belonging to a team of developers working with our big data and reporting solutions
* With us, ideas and initiatives are always welcome and we share our knowledge among each other
* We have different levels of experience in the team, and as an adept colleague, you will help teach and guide your co-workers with your experience
* We belong to the Accounts & Payments domain, consisting of 350 colleagues across Tech Area sand Business Divisions


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
* Experienced solution developer, having worked with developing Spark or Spring boot applications and solutions from scratch
* Experienced in programming with Java and Scala
* Some experience working with cloud solutions and infrastructure as code
* You have a passion for expanding your knowledge and new ways of working
* Your enjoy sharing yoir knowledge on Big Data tech and tools, and you have an interest in taking on larger responsibilities within agile development
* We at SEB work agile with SAFe and it is a plus if you have experience of working within the SAFe framework
* We believe that you are a person who understand complex issues and challenges. You like to solve problems with a systematic but still innovative approach. This role includes close contact with your team and other stakeholders, therefore we believe that you are a person with great communication and documentation skills who likes to cooperate with others


**Optionally you have:**
* Interest in global financial markets and financial products
* Experience advising and assisting junior or less technical colleagues
* Previous work experience with: C++, C# or Java
* Experience with containers and container orchestration systems
* Experience with cloud based data warehouses such as big query, redshift or snowflake


**What we offer:**
* Entrepreneurial Scandinavian environment
* Hybrid work model, meaning remote work is possible up to 2 days/week
* International opportunities and working environment
* Attractive compensation and access to SEB staff banking with exclusive benefits


**Do you want to be a part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 7th April 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Elita Šaraka at elita.saraka@seb.se , but we will not process applications via email.
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and criminal records checks. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Full stack developer (.NET/Angular) | SEB, Solna
description:
SEB is a leading northern European financial services group, and at the same time, one of the largest IT employers in the Nordics. Banking is changing rapidly, and we are proud of our reputation for being entrepreneurial and innovative in the face of change. Our brilliant techies work hard to future proof SEB’s digital architecture and customer products because it genuinely makes a huge impact for our customers and colleagues. Does that sound like a fit for you?
   

  

**About The Job**
 SEB is working firm with our digital transformation where we need your help to shape the future of the bank.
   

  

 Core Custody department are part of Custody & Investments Solution area within Technology, developing IT solutions in close cooperation with stakeholders in different business areas.
   

  

 The Safekeeping team is based in Solna. You will be a part of an agile team of highly motivated and creative colleagues that works in close collaboration with our product owners and business specialists. Cross collaboration and interaction with other teams within Technology with focus on our delivery is also part of the work.The team’s main responsibility is to develop and maintain systems supporting post trade management and transfers of securities.
   

  

 Our technical environment is a microservices architecture with responsive design for new development. Our stack includes C#, .NET Core, Angular, and JavaScript/TypeScript. We use Docker, Kubernetes, and OpenShift for containerization. For version control we useGitHub and GitHub Actions for CI/CD.
   

  

**Who we are looking for?**
 To succeed in your role with us you should behighly motivated to participate in a change journey with a long-term perspective. We also expectyou to take an active accountability for your work and for the wider team’s performance to deliver superiorservice quality to the internal counterparties and stakeholders.
   

  

 Also, you will need to have:
   

  

* worked as C# .NET developer for several years
* preferably experienced working with front end technologies such as Angular or React
* a university-level education in a field related to Information Technology, Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a closely related subject


**We also value:**
* experience in microservices and Single Page Applications
* prior experience in integrating Commercial Off-The-Shelf (COTS) solutions with internal systems
* a passion for development and like to learn new technologies, platforms, and tools
* a team player personality that understands the importance of teamwork and agile way of working
* a creative and curious mindset


**What We Offer**
 We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
   

  

* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Innovative company in forefront of technology
* Work-life balance
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Excellent office environment
* Agile and modern ways of working


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today via the link in this ad, but no later than 2025-04-10. If you have questions about the position, please contact Manager Malena Langley at malena.langley@seb.se
   

  

 Please be aware that our final candidates undergo background checks, a process that includes for example identity control, verification of qualifications, credit checks, company engagements and history of crime. In some cases, we also apply random drug checks.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 on our Career website or through our Career podcasts.
   

  

 https://sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 https://bit.ly/SEBcareer

title: Frontend engineer with focus on UI library design
description:
**About the job** 




 Are you interested in taking the next big step in your career and to help the leading Open Data company in Sweden expand? MetaSolutions is looking to strengthen their core team in delivering the best and innovative Open Data platform in the world. Is frontend development and helping out to redesign a successful javascript UI library your cup of tea? Then look no further!
 



  





**What will you do?** 




 You will work in a dedicated team alongside the founders of the company. Your primary job responsibilities will consist of redesigning and developing a UI library used to drive part of our customers' websites. You will also contribute to our Open Source libraries as well as help out with our main application EntryScape.
 



  





 As part of our team, you will have many opportunities to grow, pushing the boundaries of modern JavaScript, take on complex data workflow challenges or even lead the way in front-end development of Semantic Web and Linked Data. You will work together closely with your fellow co-workers daily, performing agile methods and techniques such as code reviews and pair programming to improve our modular applications. You will also have daily dev-syncs with your team regarding internal and external requirements and demands to our product.
 



  





**Who are you?** 




 To truly thrive in your role here at MetaSolutions we believe that you are a driven person that enjoys being in charge of your own projects. You also have an open mindset, adaptability to change and new work demands, as well as being a team player. If JavaScript, Open Source, Open Data and Open Standards interest you then you will fit in perfectly in your role as frontend developer.
 



  





**Skills and requirements:** 



* Development experience in client-side JavaScript
* Experience with one or several JavaScript frameworks
* Knowledge of HTML & CSS
* REST APIs, good knowledge of HTTP
* Understanding of accessibility according to WCAG requirements
* Ability to communicate fluently in English



  





 In addition to the skills and requirements listed above, the following skills will make you extremely irresistible:
 


* Experience with developing plugins / extensions in existing javascript frameworks
* Experience with code bundlers like Webpack or Rollup
* A good eye for design
* Knowledge of Semantic Web / Linked Data technology stack
* Ability to communicate in European languages, for example Swedish/German/French/Spanish/Italian



  





**What can we offer you?** 




 At MetaSolutions we work with the latest technologies and quality equipment. You have the possibility to work both remote and at our office, as well as flexible work hours. We consist of an international team of different languages and nationalities as we strive for diversity in our workplace. Our office is centrally located in Stockholm, with a beautiful view of the lake Mälaren.
 



 Besides everything we have listed above other benefits and perks consists of:
 


* Generous training and wellness allowance
* Free yearly health checks
* Company bike you can use
* Company events like ice skating, hiking, canoeing etc
* Allowance for a JS conference
* Swedish language courses if you need it



  





 Submit your application today, selection and interviews are ongoing.
 



  





 MetaSolutions is a company based in Sweden, dedicated to innovative solutions for advanced data management by interlinking information using semantic technologies. Our vision is to be a leading company in supporting advanced data management processes using our product EntryScape (entryscape.com).
 



  





 MetaSolutions is a spin-off from a leading research group at the Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm (KTH).

title: ServiceNow Developer
description:

 Location : Stockholm
 



 Experience : Senior Level
 



 Contact Email : anusha.kusuma@cubane.se
 



 Contact Person : Anusha Kusuma

 The role means that you will be involved in #analysis, #design and #solution together with our process and application owners.

title: Embedded-battery developer
description:
Role : Embedded-battery developer
 



 Location : Stockholm
 



 Job Type : Contract
 



 Experience : 5+ years
 



 Contact Email : anusha.kusuma@cubane.se
 



 Contact Person : Anusha Kusuma
 



  





**JOB DESCRIPTION:** 




  





 We are seeking a passionate and skilled Automotive embedded/ Battery Developer for our big customer in automotive field.
 



**Key Responsibilities:**




 • Develop and customize advanced ECU / battery systems for automotive applications.
 



 • Perform testing and validation of ECU/battery and production units to ensure safety and performance standards are met.
 



 • Analyze data and prepare reports on battery performance, reliability, and lifecycle.
 



 Qualifications:
 



 • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, Automotive Engineering, or a related field.
 



 • Experience in battery design, development, or testing within the automotive industry.
 



 • Proficiency in programming languages such as C, C++, and Python.
 



 • Experience with embedded systems design and ECU development.
 



 • Strong understanding of battery management systems.
 



 • Proficient in simulation software and tools for battery modeling and analysis.
 



 • Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
 



 • Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

title: Software Developer till Stim
description:
**Stim
 
 är en medlemsorganisation utan vinstintresse för 100 000 anslutna musikskapare och förlag. Vi arbetar för en stark upphovsrätt och för att låtskrivare och kompositörer ska få betalt för sin musik. Tillsammans med våra medlemmar ger vi förutsättningar för skapande och återväxt i Sveriges musikliv.** 




  





 Vi tror att du gillar att lösa kluriga problem, skriva vacker kod och skapa system som gör skillnad ute i världen. Vi gissar att du jobbar bäst i ett team där alla hjälps åt och lär av varandra och där du får vara med från ax till limpa - från idé till produktion.
 



  





 Du är bekväm med objektorienterad programmering och har flera års erfarenhet av PHP (pluspoäng för Java-kunskaper). Du är också redo att gå vidare och lära dig Go.
 



  





 Har vi rätt? Då borde vi prata!
 



  





**Om rollen** 




 Stim utvecklar mjukvara och tjänster till över 100 000 anslutna medlemmar och kunder. Varje år bearbetar vi data för att kunna betala ut omkring 3 miljarder till våra musikskapare.
 



  





 Nu söker vi en ny medarbetare till teamet som hanterar de stora inkommande datamängderna för musikrapporter. Teamets uppgift är att sortera bland radio-sändningar, Spotify-streams, live-spelningar, etc för att se till att rätt musikskapare får rätt betalt. Vi är fem teammedlemmar som jobbar tätt tillsammans med stort fokus på kvalitet.
 



  





 Ditt arbete kommer att bestå dels av att underhålla och vidareutveckla en PHP-applikation (med möjlighet att också hjälpa till med teamets Java-applikation) och dels av att planera arkitektur för framtiden, samt utveckla nya, moderna Go-applikationer.
 



  





 Din kod kommer att påverka tiotusentals musikskapare varje dag – från små indieartister till världsstjärnor. Genom smart datahantering ser vi till att de får rätt betalt för sin musik.
 



  





**Arbetsuppgifter och ansvar** 



* Designa, utveckla, och underhålla robusta tjänster med lång hållbarhet.
* Konfigurera och optimera relationsdatabaser (PostgreSQL).
* Driftsätta och underhålla tjänster på molnplattformar (GCP).
* Skriva omfattande automatiserade tester (enhets-, integrations-, last-, och röktester).
* Arbeta med CI/CD-pipelines (bonus om du har erfarenhet av GitHub Actions).



  





**Vad vi letar efter** 



* 5+ års erfarenhet av backend-utveckling.
* Kunskap i modern PHP med Laravel eller Symfony (bonus för Java-kunskaper).
* Vilja att lära dig Go, vilket du får möjlighet att göra hos oss.
* Vana att arbeta med relationsdatabaser (bonus för PostgreSQL).
* Förmåga att designa nya applikationer och refaktorera legacy-system med höga krav på kvalitet.
* Grundläggande förståelse för muntlig svenska, så att du kan hänga med under möten.



  





**Meriterande - men absolut inget krav** 



* Erfarenhet av eventbaserade och/eller distribuerade system.
* Praktisk användning av meddelandeköer (PubSub, Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc.).
* Bekant med Docker och Kubernetes (vi använder GKE och on-prem-kluster).
* Erfarenhet av övervakning med Datadog, StackDriver, Nagios eller motsvarande.
* Intresse för DevOps-metoder som IaC (Terraform, Ansible) är ett plus.
* Erfarenhet av valfri molnleverantör (vi använder GCP).
* Färdigheter inom frontend (React) är en bonus men absolut inget krav.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med gRPC för API:er samt OAuth2 och JWT:er för autentisering.



  





**Vem vi söker** 




 Som person är du självgående och driven, gillar att utveckla dig själv och verksamheten med de lösningar du bidrar med. Du har en analytisk förmåga och motiveras av problemlösning. Avslutningsvis trivs du med att samarbeta, arbeta i team och gillar att både dela med dig och att lära av andra.
 



  





**Varför Stim?** 




 🚀 Meningsfullt arbete som gör skillnad — vi är ett fundament i musik-Sverige.
 



 🤝 Starkt samarbete — vi värderar mångfald, öppen diskussion, och kunskapsutbyte.
 



 🌱 Lärande och växande — hos oss är det viktigt att alla får utvecklas.
 



 🙌 Fina förmåner — Tillgång till Stims musikstudios, förmånligt pris för gym i huset, massage och friskvård på arbetstid, och mycket mer.
 



 🏖 Flexibelt hybridarbete — vi fokuserar på resultat framför timmar på kontoret.
 



  





**Övrigt** 




 Stims teknikteam består för närvarande av cirka 40 personer, uppdelade i flera produktteam. Denna tjänst är en tillsvidareanställning med tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Vi har cirka 150 anställda som arbetar i rymliga lokaler på Hornsgatan i Stockholm. För ytterligare information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Tobias Sjösten via
 **tobias.sjosten@stim.se** 
 .
 



  





 Facklig kontaktperson för Unionen är Susan Roberts via susan.roberts@stim.se.
 



  





 Låter det intressant? Skicka in en ansökan – det räcker med ditt CV eller LinkedIn-profil! Vi kontaktar kandidater löpande, så vänta inte för länge. Sista dag för ansökningar är söndag 13 april.

title: Lead Frontend Developer
description:
Valtech is looking for a Lead Frontend Developer based in Stockholm. Are you passionate about frontend technologies
 *,* 
 do you have an eye for detail, and do you thrive in collaborative working environment?
   

  

 Are you based in Stockholm and able to work on-site with our clients in the area on a regular basis? Are you fluent in Swedish? Then you might be the person we’re looking for!
   

  

 A day in the life of a Lead Frontend Developer
   

  

 Your role as a Lead Frontend Developer and a consultant at Valtech will not only entail providing technical expertise but also understanding the business needs of our clients and effectively communicating how our solutions can address their challenges and contribute to their success.
   

  

 Your responsibilities will encompass every stage of client engagements, from initial discovery to final delivery. This will involve close collaboration with local and regional project teams, both internally at Valtech and alongside our valued clients.
   

  

**In Addition, You Will**
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, develop, and deploy frontend solutions that meet client requirements
* Contribute to the continuous improvement of our development processes and methodologies.
* Actively participate in client meetings, workshops, and presentations to ensure alignment and transparency throughout the project lifecycle.
* Engage with our clients' stakeholders from both IT and Business aligning our solutions to provide business value.
* Understand the client business and challenges.
* Guide the client into decision making.
* See the holistic view of an assignment and not just your part.
* Within you leadership, have the ability to develop others and help them grow within their role.
* Work in bigger and complex projects.


 You and the role
   

  

 You are a developer at lead level with at least 7 years of experience in the field of front-end development. You’re passionate about building scalable, and maintainable user interfaces and enjoy collaborating with teams across functions to deliver exceptional digital experiences.
   

  

 As a person, you are flexible and adaptable and can see yourself thriving in working in a fast-paced start-up like environment.
   

  

 We would love if you have
   

  

* A relevant technical education or equivalent level of experience within the following areas or similar: computer science, software engineering, application development, frontend development
* At least 7 years of experience in frontend development, especially within modern frontend stacks
* Preferable professional working experience from IT consultancy, digital agency, start-up or similar fast-paced working environment
* Proven track record of effectively engaging with stakeholders and identifying opportunities to add value to their projects
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG, etc.) to build inclusive and compliant web applications
* Flexibility to work on-site in and around Stockholm multiple times a week
* Due to a client requirement, fluency in Swedish is a strict requirement for this position


**Your Technical Skills Should Include**
* Proficiency in React, Vue, Next.js or other React frameworks
* Javascript, HTML, CSS
* GraphQL
* API integrations
* Agile tools such as Jira and Confluence


 What you can expect from us
   

  

 Valtech will always be recognised not just for the quality of the work we deliver, but for all the amazing people that make it happen. We don’t just talk about how to get things done; we really do transform by doing. We have an inclusive culture where we share our thoughts and our knowledge, we have fun together, and we care about each other. Our core values, Share, Care, Dare defines our culture and makes Valtech a workplace where you thrive and develop. Read more about life at Valtech here.
   

  

 You can read more about our benefits and what we offer here.
   

  

 Join Valtech
   

  

 Not only can you help us lead the experience revolution, but you can lead the change. The journey Valtech is on is ambitious and therefore opens doors. The more we grow – the more opportunities there are to take responsibility, implement your creative ideas, and be the innovator and driver to help move us, and our clients, forward.

title: Business Developer – Natural Resources
company_industry: Construction, Industrial Machinery Manufacturing, and Civil Engineering
description:
**What's The Role**
 The Business Developer is a technical sales role, forming part of the global Hilti Business Development community. You will create a strategy and lead its execution to increase adoption of Hilti solutions. You will play an important role, coordinating with local and global teams associated with these accounts. As a Business Developer you will proactively develop business opportunities through a selected portfolio of accounts and project involved in Natural Resources industry. Your main focus will be on Owners, EPC and Consultant accounts operating in the segment. Your aim will be to develop and grow your business by providing state of the art technical service, engineering consultancy and multi stakeholder technical solutions.
   

  

**Who is Hilti?**
 At Hilti, we are a passionate global team committed to making construction better. As a trusted partner for productivity, safety, and sustainability, we provide our customers innovative solutions that impact the buildings, roads, and infrastructure people rely on every day.
   

  

 Hilti is where individuals grow lasting careers by exploring possibilities, maximizing their potential, owning their development, and making a real difference every day.
   

  

**What does the role involve?**
 In the role you will be responsible and accountable for:
   

  

* Development of Owner, EPC and Consultant accounts operating in the segment through account standardization, project specifications and solutions, sales development (direct or indirect) and multi-level relationship management.
* Developing the strategy of the assigned accounts and segment game plans. Leading your strategy upfront with internal stakeholders such as local direct sales teams and global segment experts.
* Building and having ownership of segment project pipeline identifying largest business opportunities for Hilti in selected projects.
* Together with local sales teams, creating and implementing the strategy for most important brownfield sites for ongoing maintenance and upgrade projects.
* Proactively build-up and participate project and account capture teams to drive the aligned focus solutions, increase share of wallet and ensuring projects are executed as planned from design to construction.
* Bringing market intelligence inputs to the teams to confirm and/or update segment strategies.
* Maintaining effective communication throughout the team and the company
* Act as owner of assigned accounts.
* Drive and will to interact and meet with customers in person - finding solutions together
* Flexibility to travel within Sweden – Mining sites and related facilities located up north whereas petrochemical sites and offices in south.


 Responsibilities includes travelling abroad when needed and you will spend about 50% of your time travelling. The position is preferably located in Stockholm, but other locations could be discussed.
   

  

*For more than 10 years, Hilti Sweden has proudly been on the list in the Great Place to Work survey of Sweden's best workplaces in the category large organizations.*
**What do we offer?**
 Show us what you’re made of and we’ll offer you opportunities to move around the business – to work abroad, experience different job functions and tackle different markets. It’s a great way to find the right match for your ambitions and achieve the exciting career you’re after.
   

  

**What you need is:**
* Previous experience with working on Industríal Construction projects and ideally MSc/BSc degree in commercial, mechanical or civil engineering.
* Business development/sales experience for engineered products or sales of technical solutions.
* Excellent communication skills and creation of trust through active listening.
* Working in matrix organization - influencing via leadership, not via authority.
* Long-term strategic thinking with capability of explaining and transmitting the targets & strategy to customers, peers and management. Ability to plan a week, a month, a year in accordance with the strategy.
* Ability to influence internal and external stakeholders around the strategy while understanding external stakeholders’ pain points and trends to adjust when needed.
* Ability to work self-driven and autonomously by creating own planning and tasks to reach the targets.
* Skill of identifying, understanding and delivering sharp, high-level system selling value proposition and readiness to go into the details.
* Senior relationship management: Capable and confident while speaking to senior and C-level customers.
* Project management capabilities: Manage complexity of system selling across multiple geographies, functions and customers.
* Networking skills (internal and external) with confidence while working within a matrix


**Who should apply?**
 We have an excellent mix of people and success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the position, please contact Hiring Manager Teemu Rissanen, teemu.rissanen@hilti.com. If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please reach out to Talent Acquisition Business Partner Sara Henriksson, sara.henriksson@hilti.com.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!

title: Senior Developer Dynamics 365 SC&F
description:
At Sogeti, we believe the best is inside every one of us. Whether you are early in your career or at the top of your game, we’ll encourage you to fulfill your potential to be better. Through our shared passion for technology, our entrepreneurial culture , and our focus on continuous learning, we’ll provide everything you need to do your best work and become the best you can be.
   

  

 Senior Developer Dynamics 365 SC&F
   

  

 Your role
   

  

 As a Microsoft Dynamics Developer with Sogeti, you will be involved in spearheading the development of modifications and extensions to Microsoft Dynamics 365 SC&F applications. You will analyze requirements, design technical solutions, and provide technical expertise in creating specifications for customizations or extensions.
   

  

 In this role you will play a key role in:
   

  

* Spearheading the development of modifications and extensions to Microsoft Dynamics 365 SC&F applications.
* Analyzing requirements and designing technical solutions aligned with business goals, objectives, and architectural standards.
* Providing technical expertise in creating specifications for customizations or extensions on Microsoft Dynamics 365 SC&F solutions.
* Developing data migration procedures and integration services for seamless integration with legacy systems.


 Your profile
   

  

* Proven experience in at least 5+ ERP projects (Dynamics AX 2012 or Dynamics 365 SC/Finance) for enterprise-class customers.
* Strong ability to navigate challenging conversations and drive effective solutions to business problems.
* Holistic expertise in solution design, data migration, integration, and Dynamics 365 configuration.
* Solid knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming, Morph X/X++, and AX entity & object model.
* Familiarity with Azure DevOps, SSRS, and electronic reporting.
* Preferred skills in D365, Power Pages, .Net/C#/X++, EDI, Dynamics AX ISV solutions, AIF, Workflows, SQL Admin, and Query tuning.
* Industry vertical knowledge in Retail, Manufacturing, Distribution, Project Service Automation, etc.
* Proficiency in Power Platform is a plus.


 What we believe you will enjoy about working here:
   

  

* Strong team spirit: We value honesty, integrity, and respect for commitments, creating a fair and transparent work environment.
* Career development: We offer comprehensive career development programs and certifications in the latest technologies.
* Flexible work arrangements: We recognize the importance of work-life balance and offer opportunities for remote work and flexible working hours.
* Innovative work environment: At Sogeti, you will work with the latest technologies and be part of a dynamic team that constantly strives to deliver value through technology.


 Application
   

  

 We warmly welcome your application today, selection is ongoing! If you have questions about the position or the recruitment process, please contact our recruiting leader Marta Sundell (marta.sundell@sogeti.se).
   

  

 Part of the Capgemini Group, Sogeti makes business value through technology for organizations that need to implement innovation at speed and want a local partner with global scale. With a hands-on culture and close proximity to its clients, Sogeti implements solutions that will help organizations work faster, better, and smarter. By combining its agility and speed of implementation through a DevOps approach, Sogeti delivers innovative solutions in quality engineering, cloud and application development, all driven by AI, data and automation.

title: Lead Software Engineer
description:
*Join a fast-growing, product-led company where you’ll drive technical innovation, shape architecture, and tackle complex engineering challenges.* 




  





**About the company** 




 Proposales was founded in 2018 by Joakim Green, now the CEO. With nearly 20 years of experience building digital products, Joakim and his team have developed a leading proposal tool tailored for the global hotel industry. Proposales is the market leader in the Nordic region, trusted by hundreds of independent hotels and renowned hotel chains to streamline their proposal processes. The company operates in 25 countries and is gearing up for further expansion across Europe and eventually worldwide.
 



  





 Proposales has revolutionized the proposal standard, replacing static PDFs with interactive, mobile-friendly proposals. These can seamlessly integrate with CRM and booking systems, enabling users to respond to requests faster than ever. With an integrated e-signature, proposals become legally binding contracts in just a few clicks.
 



  





 Now is your chance to shape the future of Proposales – as well as the architecture behind! Alongside an exciting and impactful role, you’ll enjoy a competitive package, including salary, stock options, health benefits, and more. Plus, you’ll collaborate with a highly skilled, passionate team that shares your enthusiasm for innovative technologies.
 



  





 Discover their mission
 **here** 
 - (actually, this website was created from scratch by Peter, Design Engineer at Proposales).
 



  





**Responsibilities** 




 As Lead Engineer in the “Engineering – Core” team, you’ll be pivotal in driving the technical development of Proposales' platform. You’ll take ownership of building and implementing key features while tackling complex technical challenges. Working closely with Patrik, who is also a Lead Engineer, and Joachim, Tech Lead (and your direct manager) you’ll combine a deep technical understanding with a strategic approach to product development. Together, you’ll plan and prioritize tasks to ensure high-quality deliverables that meet both current and future needs.
 



  




* Enhancing and improving the architecture of the platform, with a strong emphasis on quality.
* Responsible of internal and external APIs to facilitate a great developer experience
* Collaborating with Tech Lead to balance customer needs with managing technical debt.
* Inspire and support the growing team to work smart and efficiently in order to drive development forward.
* *Note: Formal personnel responsibility lies with the Tech Lead, allowing you to focus fully on technology and teamwork.*



  





**What Proposales Values** 



* Serverless, continuous delivery infrastructure hosted on Vercel, built using Next.js, and written in TypeScript.
* Continuously exploring new technologies for sub-projects, focusing on long-term benefits and maintainability.
* Test-driven development and pair programming, favoring high code quality over faster development times.
* Adopting a functional programming style over object-oriented approaches, avoiding abstractions like middlewares or ORMs.
* Monorepos with multiple smaller projects, instead of a monolithic application.



  





**A bit about you** 



* Strong expertise in advanced JavaScript, with up-to-date knowledge of the latest developments (currently working with TypeScript, Next.js, Node.js, and React).
* Proficiency with Vercel and AWS infrastructure (RDS).
* Hands-on experience with SQL databases (using Postgres), GraphQL, database optimization, and managing transactions.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken; Swedish is a plus.
* Experience with machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) is an advantage since you get to build the technical foundation of the upcoming AI-related features in the platform.



  





 To excel in this role, you should be a curious and proactive individual who stays ahead of emerging technologies and enjoys exploring innovative techniques and approaches. You thrive in fostering a collaborative team environment where ideas flow freely, and openness is valued. Your natural problem-solving mindset helps you focus on solutions rather than challenges.
 



  





 You are detail-oriented, with a knack for planning and prioritizing tasks to ensure exceptional quality in execution. If you thrive in an autonomous role and are excited about contributing to a dynamic growth journey where your expertise will directly influence the future of product development, this is the perfect opportunity for you!
 



  





**Additional information** 




**Start date:** 
 Upon agreement.
 



**Location** 
 : Torsgatan 26, Stockholm. Proposales follows an office-first policy (3-4 days per week), emphasizing the energy and collaboration that comes from working together in the office!
 



**Additional info:** 
 A background check will be conducted prior to employment.
 



  





 The recruitment process is managed by Brillante, and you will be employed directly by Proposales.
 



 We review applications on an ongoing basis, so do not wait – submit your application today! If you have any questions, feel free to reach out to our recruitment consultant, Elice, at
 **elice.ohman@bravura.se** 
 .

title: Project Quality Engineer
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer, and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 DeLaval is now looking for a Project Quality Engineer that will be part of the Quality and Compliance Department and strengthen the proactive quality processes within the company.
   

  

**Role And Responsibilities**
* Be the ambassador for a complete and holistic approach for quality assurance in product development
* Own, develop and implement the Quality in Project Process for Quality Department
* Create a framework for activities in Idea to Offer that are critical for securing Quality
* Secure proactive quality focus through identifying quality enablers in projects and create an audit plan for them
* Actively participate in product development projects to encourage them in following activities identified to support Quality
* Build network and collaboration with other quality functions within DeLaval and build on the benefits of a joint way of working


**Qualifications**
 To be successful in this role we believe that you have:
   

  

* A university degree within electrical- or mechanical engineering or equivalent
* Expertise in Quality Assurance in Product Development projects
* Expertise in process development and implementation


 We are looking for a candidate who demonstrates exceptional leadership skills and can effectively influence others through strong communication. You are humble and excel at collaborating across various functional and hierarchical areas in an international environment. You work independently and see the bigger picture, applying a pragmatic approach to quality while focusing on what is critical to DeLaval.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.
   

  

**In Addition, We Offer**
* Secure employment and benefits from the collective agreement (occupational pension, work-related accident insurance).
* Parental leave compensation (approx. 10 percent of the employee's monthly salary).
* Wellness allowance of SEK 4 000/year.
* Private healthcare insurance.
* Flexible working hours and reduced working hours.
* 30 days paid annual leave.


**Additional Information**
 This is a full-time permanent position based at DeLaval’s headquarters in Tumba, south of Stockholm. We offer a hybrid workplace model, allowing flexibility to work remotely. As Project Quality Engineer you report to the Director Quality and Compliance within Product Management and Development at DeLaval.
   

  

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.
   

  

**Contact**
 Hiring manager: Sofia Magnusson, sofia.magnusson@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Mathias Gunnstedt, mathias.gunnstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Project Manager
description:
Do you want to work in a global company where you can contribute to a more sustainable food production? DeLaval is a leading developer, manufacturer, and supplier of solutions for dairy farmers around the world. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers do more with less.
   

  

 We are now looking for a Project Manager to the DeLaval Project Management Office (PMO).
   

  

**Purpose Of Role And Key Responsibilities**
 In our PMO, we are in total about 30 skilled and experienced project managers with 20 of us located in Tumba. We collaborate closely together and the whole team is actively engaged in our work to further improve our project and portfolio ways of working and to achieve One PMO.
   

  

 Your role will be to ensure the efficient and cross-functional management of DeLaval projects and assignments on new product development, product maintenance, and quality.
   

  

* Project and Program execution - Lead the planning, execution, and delivery of the project, while efficiently managing dependencies and risk efficiently.
* Team Leadership and Collaboration - Build efficient program and project teams, provide direction, and fostering open communication to achieve objectives efficiently.
* Stakeholder management - Manage relationships and communications with stakeholders, including upper management, product management, IT, engineering, supply chain, and market, ensuring transparency and involvement.


**Qualifications**

* Master’s degree in Engineering (MSc) or an equivalent qualification.
* Experience with agile methodologies, combined with the ability to adapt to hybrid approaches incorporating a more traditional waterfall model.
* Experience in developing large, complex systems that integrate both hardware and software components is beneficial.


 As a person, you are driven and well-structured at both operational and strategic levels, with a strong customer focus. You are humble, collaborative, and a very good communicator. Your problem-solving skills and experience in intercultural collaboration enable you to work seamlessly across diverse teams at all levels and functions within an organization.
   

  

**Working at DeLaval**
 Our core values Passion, People, Professionals and Partnerships connect individuals across entities and geographies. Success is far more than knowledge – it is strongly related to behaviour. At DeLaval we are all guided by our three behaviours: Set Direction, Make Things Happen and One DeLaval.
   

  

 We offer you a workplace like no other, where state-of-the-art technology goes hand in hand with animal welfare. DeLaval is a part of the Tetra Laval Group together with Tetra Pak and Sidel.
   

  

**In Addition, We Offer**

 We review applications ongoing. We do not accept applications via email, however if you have any questions regarding the role or the recruitment process don’t hesitate to contact us.

 Hiring manager: Susanne Dale Ekdahl, susanne.daleekdahl@delaval.com
   

  

 Recruiter: Mathias Gunnstedt, mathias.gunnstedt@delaval.com
   

  

**About DeLaval**
 Our vision is to make sustainable food production possible. As a company built on innovation, we constantly work to find ways of helping our customers, dairy farmers, do more with less by providing world-leading milking equipment and solutions.
   

  

 Today, DeLaval has approximately 4,500 passionate professionals operating in more than 100 markets around the world. DeLaval is part of the Tetra Laval Group.
   

  

 See more at corporate.delaval.com

title: Lead Developer till Insrt – En del av If
description:
*Här är chansen att uppleva det bästa av två världar – start-up-kulturens innovationstänk och frihet, med tryggheten som en etablerad och framgångsrik organisation erbjuder.* 




  





**OM INSRT** 




 Hjälp oss forma framtidens embedded-försäkringar!
 



  





**Insrt AB** 
 är ett nystartat dotterbolag till If Skadeförsäkring som fokuserar på digitala, gränsöverskridande och integrerade försäkringslösningar. Tillsammans med ditt team kommer du att bygga nya produkter från grunden – helt utan legacy – med en modern teknisk plattform och fokus på innovation. Målet är att skapa bättre och tillgängliga försäkringslösningar som fungerar sömlöst över landsgränser. Insrts kunder är företag som säljer produkter eller tjänster till privatpersoner och vill kunna inkorporera en försäkring i deras erbjudande utan att kunden själv ska behöva leta upp en försäkring på annat håll.
 



  





 Så bli en del av
 **Insrt** 
 – ett dynamiskt och nytänkande initiativ som har som mål att omdefiniera If:s försäkringserbjudande. Här får du chansen att påverka, forma den tekniska strategin och arbeta med den senaste teknologin för att utveckla skräddarsydda lösningar. Som Lead Developer får du en nyckelroll i att driva arbetet med att göra försäkringar enklare, smartare och mer tillgängliga för alla.
 



  





**ARBETSUPPGIFTER** 




 I rollen innefattar dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter att leda och utveckla högkvalitativa mjukvarulösningar, samt att säkerställa att teknikstacken förblir i framkant. Du kommer också ha en central roll i att utveckla skalbar och underhållbar kod och hålla dig uppdaterad om nya trender och teknologier inom branschen.
 



  





**Utveckling och arkitektur:** 




 • Design och implementering av högkvalitativa mjukvarulösningar
 



 • Ansvara för utveckling av skalbar och underhållbar kod
 



 • Hålla dig uppdaterad om branschtrender och nya teknologier för att säkerställa att teknikstacken förblir modern och relevant
 



  





**Tekniskt ledarskap:** 




 • Ge tekniskt ledarskap och vägledning till ett team av utvecklare
 



 • Samarbeta med produktchefer och andra intressenter för att förstå affärsbehov och översätta dessa till tekniska lösningar
 



  





**Samarbete:** 




 • Skapa en samarbetsinriktad och innovativ teamkultur
 



 • Vägleda och coacha teammedlemmar för att stödja deras professionella utveckling
 



 • Genomföra kodgranskningar för att säkerställa kodkvalitet och efterlevnad av bästa praxis
 



  





**VI SÖKER DIG SOM HAR** 




 • Dokumenterad erfarenhet som Tech Lead eller Senior Developer i en snabbväxande miljö med över 5 års utvecklingserfarenhet inom relevant teknikstack
 



 • Stark expertis inom mjukvaruutveckling med teknologier som C#/.NET, React, ARM
 



 • Erfarenhet av molnplattformar (t.ex. AWS, Azure, GCP) och mikroservicearkitektur
 



 • Obehindrad engelska samt svenska i tal och skrift
 



 • Kandidatexamen eller masterexamen i datavetenskap, ingenjörsvetenskap eller likvärdigt område är meriterande
 



  





 För att trivas i denna roll ser vi att du har förmågan att ta egna initiativ och leda både tekniska lösningar och team. Du är en skicklig problemlösare med en stark beslutsförmåga, vilket gör att du kan hantera komplexa utmaningar och fatta välgrundade beslut. Vidare har du god kommunikativ förmåga och trivs i samarbete med olika intressenter. Samtidigt som du har en god känsla för att hålla fokus på målen, även i ett snabbt tempo. Du är en engagerad utvecklare med tekniken i fokus som gärna delar med dig av din kunskap för att stötta och utveckla andra i teamet!
 



  





**ÖVRIGT** 




**Start:** 
 Enligt överenskommelse.
 



**Plats:** 
 Barks väg 15, Solna, Stockholm. Vi ser gärna att du tycker om att vara på kontoret och arbeta nära kollegor men har också möligheten att arbeta hemifrån två dagar i veckan.
 



  





 Den här tjänsten är en direktrekrytering vilket innebär att rekryteringsprocessen sker genom Brillante och du anställs direkt hos Insrt, en del av If Skadeförsäkring.
 



  





 Vi gör ett löpande urval så skicka in din ansökan redan idag! Har du frågor eller funderingar är du varmt välkommen att höra av dig till rekryteringsansvarig, Elice, på
 **elice.ohman@bravura.se** 
 .

title: SAP IS-U Consultant
description:
Are you committed and passionate about delivering solutions that support business? Do you go the extra mile to understand requirements and processes that enable to propose and build solutions that meet business needs and expectations? We are now looking for a skilled SAP consultant within IS-U to join our client's team.
   

  

**Start:** 
 According to agreement
   

**Location:** 
 Solna, Sweden
 

 or
 
 Gliwice, Poland
   

**Duration:** 
 Long term. 12 months to start, after this period our client's goal is to give you an offer or you will extend the contract through Maandag Nordic
   

  

 Our client is a leading European energy company, that has electrified industries, supplied energy to people's homes and modernized our way of living through innovation and cooperation for more than 100 years. They are on a goal to build a future where everyone can choose fossil-free ways to move, make and live. 
   

  

**Role description**
 In this role you will become a part of our clients Customer IT, that develops and operates specialized IT solutions based on SAP IS-U and SAP CRM supporting all Nordic business units of the company that has a customer relation. As a SAP IS-U consultant, you will be responsible to provide expertise to ensure that stable and reliable solutions are designed, developed, implemented and maintained and you will contribute to quality assurance activities to meet business needs.
   

  


 Your responsibilities will include: 
   


 - Initiate and maintain continuous dialogue with business stakeholders
   

 - Monitor system activities on a daily basis
   

 - Handle and resolve incidents
   

 - Create functional/technical design of error corrections, small assignments and projects.
   

 - Secure that implemented changes fulfill business needs and are compliant with relevant regulatory requirements and internal policies / guidelines. 
   

 - Coordinate changes and collaborate with other departments
 


**Functie-eisen** 

**Qualifications**
 - Several years experience within SAP IS-U or similar modules within SAP
   

 - Knowledge and experience within Service Notification/Order and EDM
   

 - Knowledge and experience within Device Management, Market communication (EDIEL) and Idoc processes
   

 - Knowledge and experience within Web Services 
   

 - Familiar with methodologies like Waterfall, Agile and ITIL 
   

 - Fluent in English in both spoken and written format
   

  

 Other knowledge that is nice to have:
   

 - Functional knowledge and experience related to SAP IS-U e.g.  Billing and Invoice processes, Workflow
   

 - Functional knowledge of relevant SAP modules e.g. SD, CRM, ILM   
   

 - Technical knowledge i.e. ABAP developer skills including debugging
   

 - Knowledge of the Swedish Utility Market
   

  

 We believe that you have strong communicative skills and a creative and analytical mindset. You are always eager to learn more even though you already have in-depth SAP IS-U knowledge and experience. Finally you are a person who wants to develop colleagues by proactively coaching and supporting them.
 


**Arbeidsvoorwaarden** 

 Hallo!
 


**Sollicitatieprocedure** 
 A Maandag® recruiter will assess your application as soon as possible to determine whether you are suitable for an open position.
 **Bedrijfsomschrijving** 

 Why Maandag Nordics? With us, you’ll get the chance to really put your ideas into action. We offer a work environment where you can grow and learn through hands-on experience - trying things out, making mistakes, and improving.
 


 For more than 35 years, Maandag® has been at the forefront of empowering people and organisations. We not only help professionals get jobs, but also connect them with a future that matches their values, desires and ambitions. Because when people are truly in the right place, they can develop themselves, fulfil their dreams and go to work with fresh energy every day. The energy and power released in the process is a catalyst for growth for companies. We started in the Netherlands, but now we also help professionals and organisations in Belgium, Poland, Dubai and Sweden. Our extensive knowledge of different markets, coupled with our wide network, enables us to make perfect matches quickly.

title: Fullstack PHP-utvecklare
description:
Vi söker en utvecklare med bred kompetens: någon som är trygg både i PHP-världen (särskilt Laravel) och som också behärskar modern frontend.
 







 Först och främst, innan vi går in på teknik: de mellanmänskliga bitarna är viktiga för oss. För att trivas på IVEO tror vi att du är en ödmjuk och snäll person som kan ge och ta feedback på ett sakligt och trevligt sätt. Alla gör fel ibland och genom att jobba med sina kollegor blir man bättre och snabbare; det betyder också att du vågar lyfta kritik och andra frågor eller svårigheter.
 








**Så här jobbar vi** 




 Som utvecklare på IVEO är du involverad i både stora och mindre projekt, från nyutveckling och arkitektur till förvaltning. Våra kunder sträcker sig från stora B2B-e-handlare som kör på vår egenutvecklade Laravel-baserade storefront, till några av Sveriges största B2C-sajter i WordPress, där vi har byggt backend och API:er i Laravel. Vi har ofta ett helhetsansvar i projekten, och med tekniskt insatta projektledare minimeras onödiga störningar, så att du som utvecklare kan få fokusera på ditt.
 







 Vi kombinerar beprövade ramverk med ny teknik och skräddarsyr lösningarna efter projektets behov. Vanligtvis jobbar vi med PHP (Laravel, WordPress) och JavaScript (Vue/Nuxt, AlpineJS, Tailwind) inom open source, samt .NET-ramverk (MVC, WebAPI, Optimizely) i Windows-miljö.
 







 En styrka i teamet är att vi håller oss uppdaterade och väljer verktyg utifrån vad som passar bäst – inte utifrån vad som alltid använts. Fungerar något inte som vi vill, så bygger vi eget, gör pull requests eller byter till något bättre.
 







 I våra WordPress-projekt använder vi olika iterationer av Roots Bedrock/Sage-stacken. I nya projekt kör vi fullt ut med Bedrock, Sage och Acorn – vilket möjliggör användning av Laravel-paket direkt i WordPress.
 



  





 I äldre projekt har vi en egen IVEO-fork av Sage där vi byggt upp stöd för collections, containers och modeller.
 







 För Laravel-projekt använder vi Forge och Envoyer. Övriga projekt hanteras via vårt eget Webpack-baserade frontend-byggsystem, vilket ger dig full frihet att jobba med den senaste versionen av JavaScript.
 








**Vem vi tror att du är** 




 Vi letar efter en erfaren utvecklare – någon som är trygg i Laravel och har använt det i skarpa projekt. Laravel är en central del av vår stack, så det är ett krav att du har djupgående kunskap om ramverket: allt från arkitekturupplägg och servicestrukturer till eventhantering, integrationer, API-byggande och prestandaoptimering.
 



 ‍
 



 Du har även god koll på modern frontendutveckling (gärna i Vue) och är van vid att arbeta självständigt i komplexa projekt tillsammans med andra seniora utvecklare.
 



 ‍
 



 Om du dessutom gillar att diskutera lösningar, bidra till förbättringar i kodbaser, kanske skriva tester ibland eller fundera över struktur och kodkvalitet, då kommer du förmodligen att trivas riktigt bra hos IVEO.
 



  





 Kika in på https://www.iveo.se/career/ för mer info om oss och hur det är att jobba här.

title: Mall & Webbdesigner hos Ungapped
company_industry: Marketing Services, Technology, Information and Internet, and Information Services
description:
Ungapped erbjuder marknadens smidigaste verktyg för
 **e-postmarknadsföring,** 
**SMS** 
 ,
 **eventhantering** 
 ,
 **enkäter** 
 ,
 **undersökningar** 
 och
 **marketing automation** 
 . Vi söker nu en kreativ och tekniskt kunnig designer till vårt Customer Success team för att skapa professionella mallar åt våra kunder.
   

  

**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Som designer hos Ungapped kommer du att ha en nyckelroll i att skapa anpassade mallar för våra kunder vid onboarding processen och för extrabeställningar.
