Netnod participates in a number of security related projects, and you might be assigned one or more of these.

### **Key responsibilities**

* Actively participate in, and for selected parts be responsible for, Netnod's participation and assignments in/with various security related projects
* As part of the projects, and in collaboration with the Product Owner, produce and maintain risk and vulnerability analysis for projects and their connection to Netnod's own operations
* Based on risk and vulnerability analyses, support work with the implementation of capacity-building measures through, for example, the creation of documentation, as well as supporting procurement, implementation and development for projects
* Follow the development of laws and other regulations that affect or may affect primarily your assigned projects, but also secondarily Netnod and our customers; and write proposals for talking points, referral responses and other input related to these developments
* Support and assist the technical departments and otherwise be well versed in the current status of Netnod's operations
* Support Netnod in the development of processes, routines and documentation
* Support the Security Department with processes and analyses regarding projects related to the certification of Netnod according to ISO27000

### **Qualifications**

* Academic degree in computer science or equivalent
* Excellent analytical skills
* Excellent collaboration skills
* Excellent ability to produce high quality documentation, referrals and similar documents (both formal and informal)
* Ability to see connections between an event, risk, measure and effect, i.e. to be able to evaluate and explain why measures should be taken or not
* Experience working in a technical organisation, ideally in the Internet or technology industry
* Excellent language skills in both English and Swedish (Internal company language is Swedish)
* Ability to travel internationally
* Technical experience within one or more of the following areas:
	+ Unix/Linux environment
	+ Installation and operation of IT-systems
	+ Software engineering, API development
	+ DNS/NTP/Networking
	+ Micro services, Virtualisation and orchestration
	+ Cloud services, cloud native technologies
	+ IDP concepts and other authentication mechanisms

  



***Note: This role is covered by the Swedish Legislation on Protective Security Act and is subject to security screening and background checks. For this reason, Swedish citizenship is required for the role.***

### **Location**


This role is hybrid and located out of our office in Solna, Stockholm. The role reports directly to Netnod’s CIO.

### **Employee benefits**


We offer an informal but highly professional culture with an emphasis on work-life balance for all our employees. Our attractive remuneration package includes benefits such as private healthcare, health and well being memberships, six weeks vacation and beneficial pension and insurances.

### **Application**


Are you interested in becoming a part of our team?


Applications will be reviewed as they arrive and interviews with qualified candidates will start as soon as they have been reviewed. This means that the selection of candidates takes place continuously and therefore the position may be filled before the application deadline.


If you have any questions regarding the role, you are welcome to contact Netnod’s CIO, Mattias Ahnberg, by email: ahnberg@netnod.se.


We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Qlosr söker kundansvarig säljare i Stockholm
description:
Är du en kundnära säljare med erfarenhet av att hantera IT-tjänster och i första hand se kunders behov översatt till en tjänstekatalog? Har du erfarenhet av kundutveckling och kundresa med en långsiktig strategi kopplat till IT-infrastruktur för kunder i SMB-segmentet? Nu finns en unik chans att vara en del av vår resa med dina erfarenheter inom IT och kontorslösningar på ett snabbväxande och personligt bolag! Hos oss får du arbeta med tekniska experter och stark lokal närvaro i hela Sverige i en roll som erbjuder stor variation och möjlighet att påverka.


Du kommer tillhöra teamet av kundansvariga som idag består av 9 fantastiska kollegor. Din placering är vårt kontor vid Medborgarplatsen i Stockholm.


**Om rollen**


Som Kundansvarig (Key Account Manager) hos är du ytterst ansvarig för kundteamet för varje kund. Kundteamets storlek och sammansättning anpassas efter kundens behov och omfattning.


Du kommer att ha en central roll i att säkerställa att våra kunder får största möjliga affärsvärde av våra paketerade IT-tjänster inom cloud, nätverk, klienter, säkerhet, print och AV. Allt som behövs för att vara en komplett leverantör av IT-till våra kunder.


Vi är inte en traditionell konsultorganisation utan fokuserar på leverans av standardiserade och skalbara IT-tjänster som hjälper våra kunder att effektivisera sin verksamhet och öka sin säkerhet med


I denna roll har du ett helhetsperspektiv för våra kunder där du proaktivt identifierar kundernas utmaningar och möjligheter, samt driver utvecklingen av deras IT-miljö i linje med deras affärsmål. Vidare kommer du att arbeta med att:


* Bygga långsiktiga relationer och skapa förtroende på SMB-företag (5–500 anställda).
* Kommersiellt ansvarig för att vi levererar enligt avtal och att vi kontinuerligt skapar värde för kunden.
* Utveckla och förädla kundavtal genom att identifiera nya behov och säkerställa att våra tjänster är relevanta och konkurrenskraftiga för våra kunder.
* Driva försäljnings- och tillväxtinitiativ inom befintliga kundkonton.
* Samverka med interna funktioner såsom tekniska specialister, projektledare och serviceleverans för att optimera kundupplevelsen.

**Exempel på projekt/arbetsuppgifter du kommer att genomföra:**


* Genomföra kundanalyser för att identifiera affärsmöjligheter och föreslå relevanta tjänster.
* Ge information kring behov av tjänsteutveckling till våra tjänsteansvariga.
* Säkerställa att kunder får en hög servicenivå genom löpande uppföljning och dialog med leveransteam och kundteam.
* Planera och leda strategiska kundmöten där vi presenterar förbättringsförslag och optimeringsmöjligheter.
* Koordinera onboarding av nya tjänster och säkerställa en bra upplevelse.

**Vem är du**


Vi söker dig som har ett par års erfarenhet av att arbeta med kundansvar och affärsutveckling, gärna inom IT- eller tjänstesektorn. Du har en god förståelse för SMB-marknaden och hur paketerade IT-tjänster kan skapa affärsnytta för kunder.


Som person är du relationsskapande, affärsdriven och lösningsorienterad. Vidare har du förmågan att se helheten, förstå kundens behov och omsätta det till konkreta lösningar. Du drivs av att skapa långsiktiga kundrelationer och identifiera affärsmöjligheter.


**Vi erbjuder dig**


Qlosr är idag 135 medarbetare och omsätter ca 500 miljoner. Vi har kontor i Stockholm (HK), Göteborg, Skara, Vänersborg, Uppsala, Uddevalla, Kristinehamn, Södertälje och Malmö. Sedan december 2024 är Qlosr en del av ECIT koncernen.


Vi har en stark värdegrund där teamkänsla och viljan att hela tiden utvecklas och göra skillnad är grunderna till vår framgång och tillväxt. Vi är ett snabbrörligt och kundfokuserat bolag där det är det ont om mellanchefer men nära till kollegor. Vi erbjuder en stimulerande arbetsplats där vi skrattar och har roligt tillsammans. Mår vi själva bra, presterar vi bra. Presterar vi bra blir våra kunder nöjda. Nöjda kunder leder till fler nöjda kunder som leder till en lönsam utveckling. Det är så vi vill ha det!


**Ansökan**


Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär? Välkommen in med din ansökan så snart som möjligt dock senast 14 april. Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.

*Qlosr* är en helhetsleverantör av IT-lösningar vilket omfattar försäljning och leverans av paketerade prenumerationstjänster inom arbetsplats, nätverk och serverdrift. Bolagets primära målgrupper utgörs av små- och medelstora företag, offentlig sektor samt den privata skolsektorn med fokus på större nationella skolkoncerner. Vi är en strategisk partner till våra kunder och hjälper dem att effektivisera sina verksamheter för att möta framtiden.

title: OTA Operations Engineer
description:
**We are looking for an "****OTA Operations Engineer" for a global automotive company in Gothenburg.**  

**Start is ASAP, One Year's contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.**

  

The company's Uptime Systems is on an exciting journey, building a new “state-of-the-art” workshop system portfolio. Challenging an industry requires new perspectives and approaches to provide the best solutions to workshops. A search is underway for an OTA Operations Engineer to join the team at Lindholmen in Gothenburg. The OTA Operations Engineer will primarily focus on planning, coordinating, and executing OTA assignments. A diverse team brings the best results, and applications from individuals of all genders and backgrounds are strongly encouraged.

**Example of Responsibilities:**


Plan and execute OTA and RVDC assignments across the vehicle fleet.


Monitor the progress and performance of OTA deployments, identifying and addressing potential issues.


Act as a key contact for internal stakeholders regarding OTA updates and software release coordination.


Use dashboards (e.g., Power BI) for visualization and tracking OTA assignment performance.


Collaborate with engineering teams to report and escalate issues requiring deeper technical analysis.


Collaborate with teams to test and validate new OTA features and updates.


Support internal teams with insights, statistics, and reports on OTA and RVDC updates.

**Requirements:**


Seeking a responsible, self-starter with the ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks in a dynamic and developing organization. The ideal candidate is a team player who is not afraid to raise concerns or ask questions to ensure clarity. At Uptime Systems, solutions cannot wait—proactivity, curiosity, and problem-solving are key to moving forward.

**Required Skills:**

* 3+ years of experience in managing and coordinating technical assignments, preferably within the automotive industry.
* Ability to monitor and analyze operational data to optimize OTA deployment performance.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to interact with various teams and stakeholders.
* Proficiency in tools such as Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
* Interest in vehicles and software updates, with a willingness to learn more about OTA functionality and processes.
* **Fluency in Swedish and English, both spoken and written.**

**Good-to-Have Skills:**

* Automotive Diagnostic Knowledge: Ability to troubleshoot and diagnose vehicle systems, with an understanding of common diagnostic processes and tools.
* Process and Analytical Skills: Problem-solving skills to troubleshoot and resolve issues related to updates or fleet performance.
* Proficiency in analyzing large vehicle data sets and creating dashboards/reports using tools like Power BI to extract actionable insights.
* Software Deployment: Basic understanding of software lifecycle and OTA update deployment processes.
* Familiarity with cloud-based platforms for deploying software and updates to vehicles.
* Cybersecurity Knowledge: Basic knowledge of secure communication methods (e.g., HTTPS, encryption).
* Understanding of cybersecurity risk management.


This is a full-time consultant position through Incluso in Gothenburg. Start is ASAP, One Year's limited contract to begin with, possibility of extension after that.


Please submit your CV as soon as possible since we will review the applications on an on-going basis.


For more information about this role, please contact Kanika Singhal, recruiter at Incluso.

title: Account Security Manager
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.


**Account Security Manager**
----------------------------

**Get the opportunity to work together with highly talented and senior consultants on exiting projects and services within Cloud & Infrastructure Services. We’re currently looking for an Account Security Manager for a large enterprise customer.**  



Capgemini offers a wide range of managed information security services to major corporate and public sector customers. In order to further strengthen our experienced information security team, we are now looking for a person for the Managed Services unit of our Cloud Infrastructure Services.
  

  

In order to succeed as an Account Security Manager, you have experience in information security consulting and extensive technical knowledge in the field of cybersecurity. You see yourself as a technology expert who can help customers get more business value from information security. You also have strong expertise in identifying customers' ICT information security needs and the ability to bring added value solutions to them. Thanks to the close cooperation with the customer, we expect you to feel at home effectively moving things forward in a people-oriented role in both Swedish and English.
  

  

**Your Role**  

The core of the job description of Account Security Manager is to take care of the customer's general data security in relation to the solutions offered by Capgemini and cooperation with the customer through regular meetings. Account Security Manager should be capable to support deliver perform below duties by working closely with accounts teams and clients:
  

* Being the single point of contact (SPOC) for client’s organization regarding supplier’s security capability and maturity, and to maintain the security governance framework, including risk management
* Provide senior security advisory in all aspects of the delivery
* Ensure that IT risk management and compliance requirements are fulfilled in service operations
* Ensure that security requirements are reflected in the services, technical infrastructure, and ways of working, and support client’s audits (for example ISO27001)
* Maintain the operational security tasks in the SOC and support client’s audits
* Maintain proper lifecycle management, quality assurance and efficiency throughout all security services
* Check and approving the customer's information security principles, measures, guidelines, and general responsibilities
* Approve and prioritize of information security development and improvement activities
* Review of data security breaches

  

**Your Profile**  

We believe that you are a person who:
  

* is passionate about Information and IT Security as well as cybersecurity
* stays current with an ever-changing threat landscape, risk and mitigation strategies and roles and responsibilities via continuous education, certification, and professional development
* has the ability to spot and assess security risks wherever they may exist
* Have full working proficiency in both Swedish and English

  

We also expect you to have experience in the following requirements:
  

* Information security services and solutions related to cybersecurity, such as: Strong Authentication, IAM, Cloud Security, Network Security, Security Encryption, DLP, Firewall, IDS/IPS, End Point Security, Vulnerability Management, SIEM
* The ITIL framework
* Ability to write system descriptions and process documentation, and produce quality reporting as a whole.
* CISSP or equivalent certificate (e.g., CISA/CISM)
#LI-HY1


Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of nearly 350,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong 55-year heritage and deep industry expertise, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs, from strategy and design to operations, fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud, data, AI, connectivity, software, digital engineering and platforms. The Group reported 2022 global revenues of €22 billion. Get the Future You Want | www.capgemini.com
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: ML Infrastructure Engineer
description:
### **Assignment Description**


* Develop AI/ML software products including but not limited to explore large data set, try out new algorithms, feature engineering, test and evaluate model output, deploy the solution for production usage and scale out to the comprehensive fashion network of the company.
* Design, develop and maintain the large-scale data infrastructure required for the AI/ML projects.
* Leverage on understanding of software architecture and software design patterns to write scalable, maintainable, well-designed, and future-proof code.
* Develop solutions, components, services and frameworks to address common needs in AI/ML projects, like feature reuse, model traceability, A/B test, etc.
* Work in cross-functional agile team of highly skilled engineers, data scientists, business stakeholders to build the AI ecosystem within the company.

**Required Skills**


* Have a BSc or MSc degree in computer science, engineering or related field, or equivalent practical experience.
* Professional Experience working in relevant role(s) for a Machine Learning Engineer.
* A hands-on person who loves coding, and like applying software engineering practices to machine learning projects.
* Have experience in developing software products that have been successfully deployed to production.
* Have several years of coding experience in modern programming languages, and strong background in Python programming, i.e. 3+ years.
* Have great experience with cloud technologies for ML development, preferably Google Cloud and also Vertex AI.
* Have solid experience in MLOps practices, developing ML pipelines, and deploying ML applications to production.
* Have a strong working knowledge of a variety of AI/ML techniques and experience working with different frameworks.
* Have experience handling high volume heterogeneous data (both batch and stream) and a solid understanding of data structures, databases, and data storage technologies.
* Familiar with agile ways of working, team collaboration, data-driven development, reliable and responsible experimentation.

title: AI Engineer
description:
**Start****ASAP****Duration****7-9 months**
  
**AI Engineer**


Drive innovation and transform our business as an AI Engineer in the AI and Data Center of Excellence team. You will be responsible for developing and deploying cutting-edge machine learning models and AI systems, working with technologies like natural language processing, computer vision, and predictive analytics to optimize performance and scalability.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Develop and deploy machine learning models and AI systems, applying your knowledge of algorithms, deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), and programming languages like Python.
* Optimize models for performance and scalability, ensuring efficient and timely solutions that address business needs with a sense of urgency.
* Collaborate with Data Engineers and Analytics Engineers to integrate AI solutions into our data ecosystem, fostering cross-functional collaboration and knowledge sharing.
* Contribute to a culture of innovation and learning by staying abreast of the latest advancements in AI, sharing your knowledge with the team, and actively participating in the development and implementation of new ideas.

**Desired Skills & Experience**

* Expertise in machine learning algorithms, deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch), and programming languages like Python.
* Solid understanding of statistics and mathematics.
* Experience with cloud platforms and big data technologies.
* Strong communication skills to effectively convey complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* A passion for AI and a desire to contribute to a data-driven organization.


Location: Stockholm ( 2-3 days on site)


Start: ASAP  

End: 31-12-2025

title: Senior Product Engineer
description:
**About Us**
------------


Platform Engineering is reshaping how enterprises build and run their cloud-native setups, and Humanitec is leading this transformation. Our mission is to help teams build Internal Developer Platforms (IDPs) that unlock true developer self-service.


Through our community-driven initiatives, like platformengineering.org and PlatformCon, we are not just following the trend, but defining it. With a growing list of enterprise customers and skyrocketing IDP adoption, we are expanding our team.


This is where you come in.

**About the Role**
------------------


We are looking for a Senior Product Engineer to help us scale our work to build and scale our category-defining Platform Orchestrator. As a Product Engineer, you will share ownership of how our products are built and evolve, contributing to both our short-term deliverables and long-term vision.


We work across a modern, diverse stack, including:

* Microservices (APIs) written in Go, running on Kubernetes
* Tests written in Go, Robot Framework, and more
* Web apps and VSCode extensions built with React and TypeScript
* CLI written in Go
* Emerging areas, including chat-based interfaces built on third-party LLMs


To thrive in this role, you must be comfortable with start-up life: shipping constantly, rolling up your sleeves to help debug customer issues, working on and contributing to a frequently evolving roadmap, and picking up work across our stack, with a focus on impact.


Humanitec is an all-remote company. Our small teams work closely to do big things. This is a fully remote position. Preferred time zones for this role are UTC-1 to UTC+3.

**What You Will Bring:**
------------------------

* **Excellent communication & collaboration:** You are comfortable working in a fully remote environment, working across GitHub, Notion, Slack, Jira, and more. You prioritize and protect your focus time, but don't hesitate to jump on a call when a situation demands it. You don’t offload communication or coordination to product/project managers – you own our work end-to-end.
* **Strong problem-solving and coding skills:** You value designing solutions to customer problems – from researching and defining use cases, to writing design documents, to implementing clean solutions that address them.
* **Hands-on experience with infrastructure:** whether you’ve been part of an on-call rotation or just working day-to-day observability tools, you are comfortable rolling up your sleeves to understand the factors at play in an incident or service degradation.
* **Pragmatism:** You are comfortable balancing “perfect” with “good enough,” as an individual and as part of a team.
* **Modern cloud experience:** You have built and run apps on Kubernetes on cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure. You are familiar with Docker, IaC (Terraform or OpenTofu), and modern CI/CD pipelines.
* **Bias to action:** You thrive in fast-paced, often ambiguous environments. You take initiative, use pragmatism when making decisions, and value progress over perfection.

**What You Will Do:**
---------------------

* **Contribute to our core product:** Engineering at Humanitec is a team sport. You’ll work across our stack - primarily in Go - on services that power our applications. (Experience working in Go is a plus, but not required.)
* **Design and refine technical systems:** You will share ownership of customer use cases and the systems that power them – microservices, customer interfaces, automated tests – and help shape them to remain scalable, reliable, and elegant as they evolve.
* **Collaborate closely across disciplines:** You will partner with colleagues across the organization to explore problems, prototype ideas, and iterate quickly.
* **Improve how we build:** We value thoughtful abstractions, clean interfaces, and solid testing. You will help to continuously evolve our engineering pratices.


If this sounds like a fit, we would love to hear from you!


Have questions before applying? Reach out to us at careers@humanitec.com

title: Arbetsterapeut med intresse för smärtrehabilitering, vikariat
description:
Verksamhetsområdet geriatrik, rehabiliteringsmedicin och smärtcentrum består flera olika sektioner. Samtliga sektioner kännetecknas av välfungerande interprofessionellt samarbete, något vi är mycket stolta över. Vi vill att du ska känna dig välkommen till oss, som ny erbjuds du handledning, introduktionsprogram och yrkesnätverk.  

  

Vi är experter på rehabilitering men strävar alltid efter att bli ännu bättre. Smärtcentrum är en av de största smärtenheterna i Sverige. Vi rör oss i framkanten av utvecklingen av smärtbehandling. Som en del i detta ligger ett stort fokus på forskning och framsteg, både inom och utanför sjukhuset. Som medarbetare är du en viktig del i detta, det är naturligt för dig att vilja utvecklas och driva verksamheten framåt.  

  

Nu söker vi en vikarie för en av våra arbetsterapeuter på vår smärtrehabiliteringsmottagning. Mottagningen ligger ute på specialistrehabiliteringsenheten vid Ultuna. På enheten finns sammanlagt en grupp på 12 Arbetsterapeuter och goda möjligheter till kollegialt utbyte. Smärtrehabilitering sker främst i tvärprofessionella team. I verksamheten görs också multiprofessionella smärtutredningar. Vikariatet innebär också att man är en liten del på den palliativa avdelningen i huset  

  

**Ditt uppdrag**  

Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter sker tillsammans med dina teamkollegor, där du bidrar med den arbetsterapeutiska kunskapen och erfarenheterna. Insatserna kring patienter med långvarig smärta omfattar bland annat bedömningar och behandling samt undervisning med fokus på beteendeförändring. Patientkontakter sker främst individuellt. Fokus ligger på att skapa beteendeförändringar och arbetsterapeutens insatser syftar till att hjälpa individen till hållbara förändringar för en fungerande och meningsfull vardag. I mötet med patienten arbetar du ofta självständigt men träffar även patienten tillsammans med andra professioner. Arbetet ställer krav på både samarbetsförmåga och självständighet med ett nära teamsamarbete. Du ska också vara tillgänglig 20% av din tid för den palliativa avdelningen i huset främst med uppgifter som ADL-bedömningar och förskrivning av hjälpmedel.  

  

**Dina kvalifikationer**  

Vi söker dig som är legitimerad arbetsterapeut med kunskap och/eller intresse inom smärta och rehabilitering. Du bör uppskatta teamarbete och att arbeta med patienter med multimodala problem. Det är meriterande om du har erfarenhet från arbete i öppenvård med smärtpatienter och beteendemedicin, likaså erfarenhet av gruppverksamhet och teamarbete.  

  

Du bör vara flexibel, lösningsfokuserad och ha god förmåga att arbeta såväl självständigt som tillsammans med andra. Du sätter alltid patienten i fokus och är ansvarstagande och motiverad i ditt arbete. Du är en engagerad och positiv kollega som bidrar till en bra arbetsmiljö. Stor vikt läggs vid personlig lämplighet och samarbetsförmåga.  

  

**Vi erbjuder**  

Vi erbjuder ett vikariat på heltid under perioden 2025-04-01 - 2025-12-31.  

  

Hos oss får du förmåner som gör skillnad, läs om förmånerna här.  

  

**Vill du veta mer?**  

Avdelningschef Karin Cloud Mildton, 018 – 617 37 26  

  

Facklig kontaktperson nås via växeln, 018-611 00 00  

  

**Vill du jobba med oss?**  

Välkommen med din ansökan via länken nedan. Rekrytering sker löpande så tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.  

  

*Region Uppsala värdesätter de kvaliteter som jämn könsfördelning och mångfald tillför verksamheten. Vi ser därför gärna sökande av alla kön och med olika födelsebakgrund, funktionalitet och livserfarenhet.*  

  

*Region Uppsala krigsplacerar all tillsvidareanställd personal utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Detta innebär för den enskilda medarbetaren inga förpliktelser i fredstid utan är enkom en planeringsåtgärd.*  

  

*Kontroll mot misstanke- och belastningsregister kommer att göras avseende alla personer som arbetsgivaren har för avsikt att anställa eller anlita för patientnära arbete utifrån att de kan komma att arbeta inom psykiatrisk sjukvård, habilitering, vård av barn och ungdom eller tvångsvård av missbrukare, områden som omfattas av fakultativa registerutdrag. Detta gäller således alla som kommer att arbeta patientnära även om arbetsuppgifterna i nuläget inte är tänkta att huvudsakligen innehålla arbete med ovan nämnda patientgrupper.*

title: Data Scientist
description:
Automating classical data gathering and business intelligence, through designing and implementing machine learning based platform and potentially architecting systems that automate data gathering, analytics, and integrating their outcome into other applications. Determines the foundation for data driven and fact based decision-making. Provides the tools and intelligence to formulate strategies and future business development plans.
  

Interpretation and analysis of data using statistical techniques, visualization, and predictive analytics. Development and implementation of databases, data collection systems, data analysis, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.


Works closely with project managers and portfolio managers to jointly brainstorm on how automation can assist in ongoing operation.


  
* Manages tools, methods, and processes linked to the job.
* Is responsible for automation of the portfolio management
* Gives input to or participates in process development.
* Participates in relevant technical studies and analysis.
* Develops software and has specialized knowledge on big data analytics tools and methods.
* Ensures that the database is accessible in the organization, and is performing legitimately, and that the necessary safety measures are in place to keep the stored data safe

  
* Master’s Degree (or equivalent) in Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering
* Hands-on experience in the field of Data Science
* Familiarity of field of Machine Learning: supervised and unsupervised learning, linear and logistic regressions, random forests, gradient boosting, neural networks (RNN, LSTM, CNN), text mining and topics extraction, NLP, K-Means, decision trees, ML applied to computer vision, Generative AI, Language Models, GPT, RAG
* Deep Knowledge of Python (scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, etc), Jupyter, Spark/Scala or R data science libraries, PostgreSQL, ELK, Java, Kubernetes, Docker, micro-services-oriented architecture, collaborative tools (GitLab)
* English mandatory (written and verbal)

  
**Come create the technology that helps the world act together**  

  

Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.
  

We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work
  

  

**What we offer**  

  

Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
  

  

**Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer**  

  

Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:  

  



* One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
* Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
Workplace Pride Global Benchmark  
* 

  

At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
  

We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.  

  

  

Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.
company_description: Join Nokia and help create the technology that helps the world act together.

title: Global Contingent Workforce Partner
description:
ABOUT SINCH
  
Sinch is pioneering the way the world communicates. More than 150,000 businesses — including Google, Uber, Paypal, Visa, Tinder, and many others — rely on Sinch’s Customer Communications Cloud to power engaging customer experiences through mobile messaging, voice, and email.
  
Whether you need to verify users or craft omnichannel campaigns, Sinch makes it easy. Our AI-infused Super Network, APIs, and applications ensure you can connect with your customers reliably and securely, at every step of their journey.
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple”, and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation!
  
  

DESCRIPTION
  
We are looking for a Contingent Workforce Partner to oversee the end-to-end process for our contingent workforce and shape the future of contingent workforce management at Sinch.
  
The ideal candidate has experience in contingent workforce management, vendor relations, and workforce operations. The role will be located in Stockholm and will report to Head of Talent Acquisition EMEA & APAC.
  
Some of your key responsibilities will be;
  
* Manage the full lifecycle of contingent workers (requests, contracts, extensions, payments). You will be the primary person to handle operations in EMEA. In APAC and US, you will have support in local execution.
* Act as the primary contact and advisor for the business as well as HR in questions relating to contingent workforce.
* Manage relationships with external vendors, staffing agencies, and system providers ensuring service quality and cost-effectiveness.
* Own and refine the roadmap for contingent workforce strategy, ensuring alignment with business needs.
* Identify and implement process improvements to enhance operational efficiency.
* Enablement of key metrics reporting and insights for informed decision-making.


REQUIREMENTS
  
* Experience in contingent workforce management, HR operations, procurement, or vendor management.
* Experience with Vendor Management Systems (VMS) or HRIS platforms.
* Strong stakeholder management and communication skills.
* Strong analytical skills and strategic problem solver with experience in data-driven decision-making.
* Knowledge of workforce compliance, contracts, and procurement processes.
* Experience in global or multi-country workforce management. Experience from the US market is an extra bonus!
* Familiarity with labor laws and regulations related to contingent workforce engagement.


OUR HIRING PROCESS
  
We are committed to ensuring a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and inclusive. Our approach includes structured, competency-based interviews designed to evaluate your skills, experience, and qualifications relevant to the role. At times, we may include a data-driven assessment to enhance our hiring success and identify candidates likely to excel.
  
We believe in a two-way process and encourage you to ask questions throughout the journey. If this role isn't what you're looking for, please explore the other opportunities listed on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/. No matter who you are, we hope you find an exciting path forward - hopefully with us!
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: Product Owner - Embedded Systems
description:
Who are we
  
1731 Consulting AB is a next generation Consulting, Technology and Services Company with deep focus on Innovation. We help enterprises transform and thrive in a changing world by co-creating breakthrough solutions that combine strategic insights and execution excellence.
  
An exciting opportunity
  
Our client, a renowned Swedish multinational automobile manufacturing corporation is on the lookout for a Product Owner to lead the development of Embedded Systems focusing on the coordination and integration of software and hardware for Electronic Control Units (ECUs).
  
What you will do
  
Act as the central point of contact for coordination between internal teams, external suppliers, and stakeholders in the development of embedded ECU systems.
  
Translate high-level functional descriptions into detailed technical requirements for both hardware and software components.
  
Lead the integration and rollout of new software/hardware across global engineering sites, collaborating closely with teams in different regions.
  
Drive test and verification activities, particularly for climate control modules, including sensor integration, actuator control, and thermal system behavior under various environmental conditions.
  
Analyze and resolve quality issues during both development and industrialization phases, including fault tracing, logging, and root cause analysis.
  
Provide support for validation and troubleshooting throughout the development lifecycle, including on-vehicle and rig-based testing.
  
Facilitate clear and efficient communication with suppliers on specifications, diagnostics, and compliance topics.
  
Promote continuous improvement by contributing to agile process enhancements, testing methodologies, and product efficiency strategies.
  
  

What the candidate shall bring
  
10+ years of experience in embedded systems development, with recent hands-on involvement in thermal management, infotainment, or connectivity domains.
  
Strong background in test, integration, and verification of climate control modules and related systems, including experience with environmental testing and system calibration.
  
Proven leadership in troubleshooting complex issues across hardware and software domains.
  
Familiarity with test object management, software distribution, system architecture, and cloud-integrated service verification.
  
Proficient in Agile/SCRUM methodologies, with certifications such as Product Owner and Scrum Master.
  
Practical experience with tools like CANoe/CANalyzer, JIRA/VIRA, Splunk, and test/data management tools.
  
Experience working within international, multi-disciplinary teams across various project phases.

title: Azure Infrastructure Solution Sales Specialist
description:
**Overview**
 Join our team of experienced solution sales specialists and technical experts to help our most important customers achieve digital transformation with Azure cloud services. Our ambition is to truly partner up with our customers and aim for the long-term gains, always finding ways for our customers to achieve more using the possibilities of technology.
   

  

 As an Azure Infrastructure Solution Sales Specialist, you work as a trusted advisor, equipped with both business and technical expertise, with our most important customers. You will orchestrate and lead a virtual team of technical, partner and consulting resources to advance the sales process and achieve/exceed solution sales and consumption targets for related workloads in your assigned accounts. You possess both a high emotional intelligence with executive presence, able to engage with senior decision makers to uncover digital transformation initiatives, and a passion for learning how Azure cloud services can deliver digital transformation. You will develop and maintain an Azure Infrastructure expertise, able to identify projects, build a compelling business case, and drive the consumption project to production. You will build and maintain relationships with customers, influence long-term strategic direction and act as a trusted advisor driving engagement at the C-suite level with technology decision makers. You will help customers evaluate their cloud strategy, determine approaches to application and data migration and modernization, and recommend solutions that meet their requirements.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Solution Sales Specialist you have a very central role in creating value and growth for the entire eco-system in collaboration with its members.
   

  

**Sales Execution**
* You are working with named major accounts as a part of the Microsoft customer team. You will together with the rest of the team build and align around a common account plan. As a Solution Sales Specialist you initiate and lead conversations with customers on digital transformation in their industry and solution areas, in collaboration with partners and services. You create and close opportunities with customers through various engagement methods.
* You collaborate with team members, account teams, partners, and services to discover, qualify, and build pipeline of new opportunities. You build customer relationships via social selling. You apply Microsoft’s sales process to assess and proceed with opportunities.
* You drive consumption and growth with existing customers by providing demos, quotes, and deployment plans, in collaboration with partners and internal teams.
* Identifying customer business needs and assessing their technology readiness is one essential part of the job. You develop and propose solutions together with your peers and colleagues that align with customers’ needs and deliver business value.
* You build external stakeholders’ mapping and engage senior decision makers at the customer’s/partner’s business, in collaboration with account teams.
* You implement strategies and close plans to accelerate and de-risk deal closure. You coach less experienced team members in deal plan execution.


**Scaling and Collaboration**
* One of the core requirements of this job is the ability to collaborate and orchestrate for success. You collaborate with Microsoft Partner Organization and our partners to cross-sell and up-sell. You identify and develop new partners and partner strategies based on customer scenarios.
* In your work as a Solution Sales Specialist you apply the orchestration model to leverage and expand relationships with internal stakeholders and partners. You navigate the Microsoft organization to bring the best impact to the customer.
* In ideal situations, the account team will identity leads for Azure services, which you will qualify, extend and develop a convincing business case. After you secured the decision, you will hand over deployment to Microsoft support organization and our partners to help the customer implement.


**Technical Expertise**
* You lead and mentor others in conversations and events within Microsoft and with prospective customers/partners. You contribute ideas and best practices across Microsoft.
* You act as a subject matter expert in one or more solution area(s).
* You collaborate with our global compete team and our product groups to analyze and position Microsoft against competitors and land our new products in customer communication. You evaluate and recommend opportunities based on the competitive landscape and the value of Microsoft platform.


**Sales Excellence**
* Collaborating with partners and resources and leverage customer insights or industry knowledge is one key area in excelling in the role as a Solution Sales Specialist. You explore new opportunities to optimize your portfolio and help customers innovate.
* Equipped with experienced your part in reviewing feedback and coaching others to improve customer/partner satisfaction is valued. You lead sales and delivery success with your account and pursuit teams.
* You engage with stakeholders on business planning and Rythm of Business (ROB) meetings to review and plan for your accounts.
* You work with the sales team, partners, and marketing to do business analysis (e.g., whitespace analysis, industry trends) to target high-potential customers and stakeholders.
* You manage the business of your territory including forecasting and developing a plan to sell strategically to meet your and customer's goals.
* You complete training and get product and role certifications for your role and industry.


**Qualifications**
**Qualifications**
 Extensive technology-related sales or account management experience
   

  

 OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration or related field AND several years technology-related sales or account management experience.
   

  

**Additional Or Preferred Qualifications**
 Significant technology-related sales or account management experience
   

  

 OR Master's Degree in Business Administration (i.e., MBA), Information Technology, or related field AND several years technology-related sales or account management experience.
   

  

 Several years solution or services sales experience.
   

  

 Experience in selling to public sector customers is considered an advantage, especially cloud services. Interest in digitalization and understanding of compliance requirements in public sector is also a plus.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request via the Accommodation request form .
   

  

 Benefits/perks listed below may vary depending on the nature of your employment with Microsoft and the country where you work.

title: Senior ML Engineer
description:
**Company Description**
 We're an award-winning Google Cloud partner. We're the experts in transforming businesses and shaping the future of cloud technology. Join us and collaborate with top minds, build groundbreaking solutions, and make a real difference for our clients. Enjoy extensive professional development, global reach, and a supportive, Google-inspired culture. If you're passionate about the cloud, this is where you want to be.
   

  

 With over 13 years of experience in Google Cloud under our belt, offices in 18 countries and more than 600 experts, we have deployed practical innovation alongside Google. We focus on infrastructure modernisation, data management, smart analytics, application modernisation, and AI & machine learning.
   

  

 Curious about our projects? We got you: Check out our success stories
   

  

  

**Job Description**
**Day-to-day life**
* Design, develop, and deploy cutting-edge machine learning models – crafting bespoke AI solutions for our Nordic clients.
* Collaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and Google experts to overcome complex challenges and deliver impactful outcomes.
* Champion knowledge sharing and mentorship, guiding junior colleagues in the art of machine learning and fostering a culture of continuous learning.
* Stay at the forefront of Google Cloud AI/ML technologies, continuously expanding your expertise and exploring new possibilities.
* Confidently present solutions to clients, bridging the gap between complex algorithms and real-world business value, while actively cultivating and expanding those customer relationships.


 Want to know more?
 
 Check out our people stories on Youtube
   

  

  

**Qualifications**
 We're seeking a passionate and experienced ML Engineer with a proven track record in designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models. You'll be a cloud enthusiast with a deep understanding of AI/ML principles and hands-on experience with cloud technologies. As a coding expert, you'll possess strong Python skills and a solid foundation in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, LangChain, LangGraph).
   

  

  

  

 Excellent communication is essential – you'll build strong relationships with clients, translate their needs into innovative AI solutions, and present complex topics with clarity and confidence. You're a true collaborator, thriving in team environments where knowledge sharing and mutual support are paramount.
   

  

 Fluency in both
 **Swedish** 
 and
 **English** 
 is required.
   

  

  

**Additional Information**
**Why Choose Devoteam G Cloud?**
* Own the AI revolution: Dive into the exciting world of Generative AI and ML, playing a pivotal role in shaping projects around Google's groundbreaking Gemini foundation model.
* Innovative Impact: Work on the forefront of cloud technology at a globally recognized leader in Google Cloud solutions.
* Direct Google Connection: Collaborate closely with Google teams, shaping the future of cloud and AI.
* Unleash Your Expertise: Thrive in a fast-paced environment where sharing knowledge and success is paramount.
* End-to-End Impact: Drive complete business transformations, from strategy to implementation and beyond.
* Accelerate Your Career: Grow within a Google-inspired culture, gaining specialisations and certifications.


*"Partnering with Devoteam has been a highlight of our efforts at Google Cloud. Their dedication and expertise elevate every project we undertake together. It's truly a collaboration that delivers exceptional results." — Alexander Percivall, Senior Partner Engineer, Google Cloud Nordics, Stockholm, Sweden.*
 We do plenty of activities, like meet-ups, hackathons, and partnerships. Don’t lose any of them: follow us on LinkedIn
   

  

**Benefits**
* Encouragement and support for training and certification, in the form of coaching from other team members, cost coverage, and financial incentives.
* Challenging and rewarding assignments, many of which are end-to-end.
* A hybrid work model as standard, with flexible working hours and location to support your work-life balance.
* An international, diverse, and inclusive team.
* A human-centric and value-based company culture.
* Wellness grants for sports activities (5,000 SEK/year).
* A modern office in central Stockholm.
* Full provision of work tools.
* A variety of social events.


 Our culture is based on continuous learning and career development, supported by a genuine, inclusive, and expert team that really loves pizza.
   

  

  
   

  

 Want to know more about life at Devoteam? Check our Instagram page
   

  

 Ready to join an elite team? Apply for our Senior ML Engineer position and become part of something exceptional!
   

  

 Is this not the right position for you? Don’t worry, we have plenty of opportunities! Check out our Career page

title: Senior Vice President, Corporate Solutions
description:
The Apex Group was established in Bermuda in 2003 and is now one of the world’s largest fund administration and middle office solutions providers.
   

  

 Our business is unique in its ability to reach globally, service locally and provide cross-jurisdictional services. With our clients at the heart of everything we do, our hard-working team has successfully delivered on an unprecedented growth and transformation journey, and we are now represented by over circa 13,000 employees across 112 offices worldwide.Your career with us should reflect your energy and passion.
   

  

 That’s why, at Apex Group, we will do more than simply ‘empower’ you. We will work to supercharge your unique skills and experience.
   

  

 Take the lead and we’ll give you the support you need to be at the top of your game. And we offer you the freedom to be a positive disrupter and turn big ideas into bold, industry-changing realities.
   

  

 For our business, for clients, and for you
   

  

**Senior Vice President, Corporate Solutions**
**Role Location: Apex Sweden**
 Department: Corporate Solutions
   

  

 Employment Type: Permanent, Full Time
   

  

**The Role**
 This is a senior operational role within the Corporate Solutions pillar of Apex and has a wide array of responsibilities including, but not limited to, leading a function with responsibility for delivering governance, fiduciary, accounting and administration support.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage direct onshore reports and work closely with offshore indirect reports to ensure a high quality and excellently co-ordinated service is delivered to client relationships
* Providing technical support to the administration team on all aspects of client service, particularly with respect to financial accounting and tax
* Oversee the full lifecycle management of corporate structures, from incorporation and formation, to include adherence to AML, day-to-day administration, domiciliation, financial accounting, cash management, and payment processing
* Establish, cultivate and manage strong relationships and networks with intermediaries and internal contacts,
* Lead the Corporate Solutions function locally with responsibility for the development and leadership of the team members
* Attend industry training as is required to ensure that you have and maintain the appropriate technical knowledge required to perform your role and to understand the regulatory obligations to which you are subject to
* Prepare monthly performance reports on service delivery for Group-level review
* Reviewing and preparation of annual financial statements to required standard and deadlines
* Performing and overseeing ongoing accounting activities to ensure accuracy, compliance, and timely reporting.
* Review transaction documents to ensure adherence to regulatory requirements
* To obtain internal and external stakeholder feedback and drive increases in client satisfaction and engagement
* Ensure the timely and accurate resolution of any internal or external issues and ensure effective open and clear communication processes are in place
* Continuously challenge existing practices by promoting efficient use of our systems and processes to enable growth and facilitate the expansion of our capabilities
* To understand relevant accounting standards, laws, practices, treaties, and regulations that underpin our client requirements
* Establish and maintain sound motivational people management practices. Ensure employee development is aligned to business objectives and oversee and measure effective work processes and practices within the team
* Review service delivery against the client fee structure and escalation service creep where applicable
* Coordinating with our Sales team when identifying new business opportunities and or the development of our services
* Any other duties in the scope of the role that the company requires


**Skills required:**
* A minimum of 5 years overall experience in a similar role and at least two years’ experience acting on client entity boards
* A professional accounting qualification and good understanding of both local and international accounting standards and tax regulation
* A track record of developing revenue from new and existing clients
* Excellent networking, communication, organisational and leadership skills
* Proven ability to build and manage a team
* A good understanding of Swedish company law and other related legal and regulatory requirements as well as a working knowledge of relevant Swedish tax issues
* A keen awareness of risk issues in the context of fiduciary responsibilities
* Motivated and driven with an ability to work under pressure to tight deadlines and demanding financial targets
* A willingness to travel as business needs dictate
* An ability to embrace and execute change while providing support to employees through the process


*The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of the work being performed. They are not construed as an exhaustive list of all deliverables, responsibilities and duties. All Apex employees are expected to be flexible in approach and may be required to perform other duties as may be reasonably required for the benefit of the Company, and to add value.*
 Disclaimer: Unsolicited CVs sent to Apex (Talent Acquisition Team or Hiring Managers) by recruitment agencies will not be accepted for this position. Apex operates a direct souring model and where agency assistance is required, the Talent Acquisition team will engage directly with our exclusive recruitment partners.

title: Azure Infrastructure Solution Sales Specialist
description:
Join our team of experienced solution sales specialists and technical experts to help our most important customers achieve digital transformation with Azure cloud services. Our ambition is to truly partner up with our customers and aim for the long-term gains, always finding ways for our customers to achieve more using the possibilities of technology.
   

  

 As an Azure Infrastructure Solution Sales Specialist, you work as a trusted advisor, equipped with both business and technical expertise, with our most important customers. You will orchestrate and lead a virtual team of technical, partner and consulting resources to advance the sales process and achieve/exceed solution sales and consumption targets for related workloads in your assigned accounts. You possess both a high emotional intelligence with executive presence, able to engage with senior decision makers to uncover digital transformation initiatives, and a passion for learning how Azure cloud services can deliver digital transformation. You will develop and maintain an Azure Infrastructure expertise, able to identify projects, build a compelling business case, and drive the consumption project to production. You will build and maintain relationships with customers, influence long-term strategic direction and act as a trusted advisor driving engagement at the C-suite level with technology decision makers. You will help customers evaluate their cloud strategy, determine approaches to application and data migration and modernization, and recommend solutions that meet their requirements.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
 As a Solution Sales Specialist you have a very central role in creating value and growth for the entire eco-system in collaboration with its members.
   

  

 Sales Execution
   

  

* You are working with named major accounts as a part of the Microsoft customer team. You will together with the rest of the team build and align around a common account plan. As a Solution Sales Specialist you initiate and lead conversations with customers on digital transformation in their industry and solution areas, in collaboration with partners and services. You create and close opportunities with customers through various engagement methods.
* You collaborate with team members, account teams, partners, and services to discover, qualify, and build pipeline of new opportunities. You build customer relationships via social selling. You apply Microsoft’s sales process to assess and proceed with opportunities.
* You drive consumption and growth with existing customers by providing demos, quotes, and deployment plans, in collaboration with partners and internal teams.
* Identifying customer business needs and assessing their technology readiness is one essential part of the job. You develop and propose solutions together with your peers and colleagues that align with customers’ needs and deliver business value.
* You build external stakeholders’ mapping and engage senior decision makers at the customer’s/partner’s business, in collaboration with account teams.
* You implement strategies and close plans to accelerate and de-risk deal closure. You coach less experienced team members in deal plan execution.


 Scaling and Collaboration
   

  

* One of the core requirements of this job is the ability to collaborate and orchestrate for success. You collaborate with Microsoft Partner Organization and our partners to cross-sell and up-sell. You identify and develop new partners and partner strategies based on customer scenarios.
* In your work as a Solution Sales Specialist you apply the orchestration model to leverage and expand relationships with internal stakeholders and partners. You navigate the Microsoft organization to bring the best impact to the customer.
* In ideal situations, the account team will identity leads for Azure services, which you will qualify, extend and develop a convincing business case. After you secured the decision, you will hand over deployment to Microsoft support organization and our partners to help the customer implement.


 Technical Expertise
   

  

* You lead and mentor others in conversations and events within Microsoft and with prospective customers/partners. You contribute ideas and best practices across Microsoft.
* You act as a subject matter expert in one or more solution area(s).
* You collaborate with our global compete team and our product groups to analyze and position Microsoft against competitors and land our new products in customer communication. You evaluate and recommend opportunities based on the competitive landscape and the value of Microsoft platform.


 Sales Excellence
   

  

* Collaborating with partners and resources and leverage customer insights or industry knowledge is one key area in excelling in the role as a Solution Sales Specialist. You explore new opportunities to optimize your portfolio and help customers innovate.
* Equipped with experienced your part in reviewing feedback and coaching others to improve customer/partner satisfaction is valued. You lead sales and delivery success with your account and pursuit teams.
* You engage with stakeholders on business planning and Rythm of Business (ROB) meetings to review and plan for your accounts.
* You work with the sales team, partners, and marketing to do business analysis (e.g., whitespace analysis, industry trends) to target high-potential customers and stakeholders.
* You manage the business of your territory including forecasting and developing a plan to sell strategically to meet your and customer's goals.
* You complete training and get product and role certifications for your role and industry.


**Qualifications**
 Qualifications
   

  

 Extensive technology-related sales or account management experience
   

  

 OR Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration or related field AND several years technology-related sales or account management experience.
   

  

**Additional Or Preferred Qualifications**
 Significant technology-related sales or account management experience
   

  

 OR Master's Degree in Business Administration (i.e., MBA), Information Technology, or related field AND several years technology-related sales or account management experience.
   

  

 Several years solution or services sales experience.
   

  

 Experience in selling to public sector customers is considered an advantage, especially cloud services. Interest in digitalization and understanding of compliance requirements in public sector is also a plus.
   

  

 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Infrastrukturspecialist inom VMware
description:
Brinner du för infrastruktur och teknik, och tycker du om att ligga i framkant med de senaste lösningarna? Vågar du utmana kunder med nya tekniska lösningar och förbättringar? I takt med att vår kund växer, söker de nu förstärkning till deras konsultteam inom Infrastruktur och VMware. Vi söker dig som är en senior infrastrukturspecialist med spetskompetens inom VMware och som vill bli deras expert inom området.
   

  

 Område: Solna
   

  

 Start: Omgående, med hänsyn till uppsägningstid
   

  

 Tjänsten inleds som ett konsultuppdrag med ambitionen att anställningen ska gå över till kunden.
   

  

 Som konsult på Centric får du en trygg anställning och samlar på dig värdefull arbetslivserfarenhet på uppdrag hos våra kunder. Din konsultchef stöttar dig i din utveckling där du hela tiden fyller på med nya erfarenheter och kunskaper. En utmärkt möjlighet att göra karriär.
   

  

**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 
 I rollen som infrastrukturspecialist kommer du att arbeta med design, implementering och förvaltning av avancerade VMware-miljöer och Windows-miljöer. Du kommer att ansvara för att skapa och underhålla robusta och skalbara infrastrukturlösningar samt agera rådgivare inom ditt expertområde. Du förväntas också arbeta med dokumentation och förbättring av befintliga system. Du kommer att tillhöra ett team som idag består av sju personer som alla arbetar inom nätverk och infrastruktur.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer** 
 För att trivas i rollen drivs du av att ge bra service och arbeta mot både individuella och gemensamma mål. Du är en teamspelare, flexibel och har förmågan att hantera ett varierande tempo. Du trivs med att ta eget ansvar och att arbeta både självständigt och i grupp.
   

  

 Vi söker dig med minst 10 års erfarenhet inom infrastruktur och djup kunskap inom VMware. Du har erfarenhet av att designa och förvalta komplexa infrastrukturlösningar från grunden. Du har ett stort tekniskt intresse, är självgående och stresstålig. Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

*För att passa för rollen behöver du ha kompetenser inom:*
* VMware-produkter och lösningar (vSphere, vSAN, NSX)
* Windows Server-miljöer (AD, DNS, DHCP, GPO)
* Design och implementering av infrastrukturlösningar
* Erfarenhet som konsult och rådgivare inom infrastruktur
* Automatisering och orkestrering av infrastrukturer
* Molnintegrationer (Azure, AWS)
* Drift och underhåll av stora, komplexa system


**Meriterande Erfarenheter**
* Säkerhetslösningar inom VMware
* Outsourcing
* Projektledning enligt PPS-modellen


**Vad vi erbjuder** 
 Vi hjälper dig att nå dina personliga mål. Vi tycker nämligen att alla våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas, oavsett om de är juniorer eller har några år på nacken. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Och inte nog med det – du som konsult får även lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan utifrån dina speciella intresseområden, där vi tar notan för både studiematerial och certifieringar. Hos oss på Centric kommer du snabbt in i gemenskapen genom våra interna och externa aktiviteter där vi träffas och hittar på något roligt tillsammans.
   

  

 Centric är ett IT-företag med 400 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Data Scientist
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and Telecommunications
description:
**Job Description**
 Automating classical data gathering and business intelligence, through designing and implementing machine learning based platform and potentially architecting systems that automate data gathering, analytics, and integrating their outcome into other applications. Determines the foundation for data driven and fact based decision-making. Provides the tools and intelligence to formulate strategies and future business development plans.
   

  

 Interpretation and analysis of data using statistical techniques, visualization, and predictive analytics. Development and implementation of databases, data collection systems, data analysis, and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.
   

  

 Works closely with project managers and portfolio managers to jointly brainstorm on how automation can assist in ongoing operation.
   

  

**How You Will Contribute And What You Will Learn**
* Manages tools, methods, and processes linked to the job.
* Is responsible for automation of the portfolio management
* Gives input to or participates in process development.
* Participates in relevant technical studies and analysis.
* Develops software and has specialized knowledge on big data analytics tools and methods.
* Ensures that the database is accessible in the organization, and is performing legitimately, and that the necessary safety measures are in place to keep the stored data safe


**Key Skills And Experience**
* Master’s Degree (or equivalent) in Statistics, Machine Learning, Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering
* Hands-on experience in the field of Data Science
* Familiarity of field of Machine Learning: supervised and unsupervised learning, linear and logistic regressions, random forests, gradient boosting, neural networks (RNN, LSTM, CNN), text mining and topics extraction, NLP, K-Means, decision trees, ML applied to computer vision, Generative AI, Language Models, GPT, RAG
* Deep Knowledge of Python (scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, etc), Jupyter, Spark/Scala or R data science libraries, PostgreSQL, ELK, Java, Kubernetes, Docker, micro-services-oriented architecture, collaborative tools (GitLab)
* English mandatory (written and verbal)


**About Us**
**Come create the technology that helps the world act together**
 Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world.
   

  

 We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work
   

  

**What we offer**
 Nokia offers continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered.
   

  

**Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer**
 Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality:
   

  

* One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere
* Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg
* Workplace Pride Global Benchmark


 At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
   

  

 We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.
   

  

 Join us and be part of a company where you will feel included and empowered to succeed.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Nokia Bell Labs is the world-renowned research arm of Nokia, having invented many of the foundational technologies that underpin information and communications networks and all digital devices and systems. This research has produced nine
   

  

 Nobel Prizes, five Turing Awards and numerous other awards.

title: IT-tekniker
description:
IT-tekniker till Göteborg eller Stockholm
   

  

**Vill du bli en del av ett team hos en ledande aktör inom molntjänster och digital transformation?**
 Hos Coegi är vi familjära, värdesätter långsiktiga relationer och medarbetartrygghet, med en stimulerande arbetsmiljö vill vi att du som vår nästa medarbetare skall kunna växa och utvecklas tillsammans med oss. Arbetet sker nära verksamheten med goda möjligheter att påverka såväl bolagets utveckling som din egen!
   

  

**Vad har Alexander Matta, senior IT-specialist Coegi, att säga om tjänsten?**
*"För att lyckas och trivas i rollen krävs en vilja att utvecklas som person men också en vilja att bidra till utvecklingen av verksamheten samt våra kunder. Det är viktigt att kunna ta eget ansvar och arbeta självständigt, samtidigt som man delar med sig av sin kunskap och kompetens. En förståelse för och en vilja att bidra till våra kunders framgång, samt att vara en del av vår företagskultur, är avgörande för framgång i rollen."*
**Din profil**
 För rollen som IT-tekniker söker vi dig som är nyfiken, älskar kundservice, teknik och problemlösning. Du har arbetat några år i yrket som IT-tekniker med fokus på nätverk, säkerhet och serverlösningar. Du trivs i en roll med mycket social kontakt och sprider naturligt energi till din omgivning.
   

  

* Har relevant akademisk utbildning inom IT eller relaterat område
* Har dokumenterad erfarenhet som IT-tekniker
* Har gedigen erfarenhet inom nätverk och molntjänster
* Kommunicerar flytande på svenska och engelska


 Kunskapskrav
   

  

* God kunskap inom nätverk såsom WAN, LAN, WiFi och VPN
* Erfarenhet inom IT med djupare kunskaper inom Windows, Azure och nätverk
* Kompetens inom IT-säkerhet
* Erfarenhet av virtualisering (gärna Microsoft) och hantering av virtuella servrar


 Meriterande
   

  

* Erfarenhet av arbete som konsult
* Microsoft certifierad
* Kunskaper inom Linux
* Erfarenhet av arbete i serverhall och hantering av serverinfrastruktur


**Kontakt och ansökan**
 För mer information om jobbet eller om ni har frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta Mattias Lyckberg, 0733-336080, på Intenso Teknikrekrytering.
   

  

 Skicka in din ansökan via ansökningsknappen. Vi arbetar med löpande urval under denna rekrytering, vi vill därför gärna ha in din ansökan snarast möjligt.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan!**
**Om företaget**
*Coegi Cloud AB är ett nytänkande, teknikintresserat och framåtsträvande IT-bolag med fokus på hög servicenivå för sina kunder och samarbetspartners. Vi erbjuder en komplett IT-avdelning anpassad efter små och medelstora företagsbehov av moderna och smarta IT-lösningar. Vi är tillräckligt stora för att kunna erbjuda expert-kompetens inom respektive område, och tillräckligt små för att kunna ta ett personligt ansvar för alla våra kunders IT-miljöer. Läs mer på* 
*www.coegi.se*

title: Associate Linux Support Engineer
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1100+ colleagues in 75+ countries and very few office based roles. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing.
   

  

 We are hiring an
 **Associate Support Engineer** 
 to build a career with Canonical and support the technical needs of customers leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. This role is an opportunity for a hands-on engineer with eagerness to learn, a passion for Linux and open source technologies to work with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.
   

  

 We regularly solve interesting, technical problems. From triaging complex cloud environments, desktop and server issues, Linux kernel crashes we've never seen before to OS configuration issues and root cause analysis, we provide an expert level of support and satisfaction to our peer groups and customers. You will be accountable for delivering an outstanding technical support experience on the full technical stack at Canonical, across cloud, desktop and IoT. From problem qualification to full resolution, you will own and manage your cases. When needed, you will transfer your cases to your colleagues or involve senior engineers. This is a globally remote role.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This is a globally remote role.
   

  

**The role entails**
* Working from your remote home office to provide technical support for employees.
* Being available to take ownership of new cases via telephone, email and web
* Acting as an internal customer advocate keeping them updated in a timely manner
* Ensuring that each support case owned by you is handled according to our Service Level Agreement (SLA) with the highest possible customer satisfaction by setting the right expectations and fulfilling your commitments.
* Contributing new knowledge base articles and maintaining existing articles, ensuring shared knowledge and lessons learned are available to customers.
* Drafting and distributing technical notices for internal and external communication.
* Prioritising your work in order to accomplish the most important and urgent tasks first
* Keeping on learning as our products and services grow and evolve
* Understanding Ubuntu development process to be able to set customer expectations correctly on timeline for a fix
* Maintaining regular communication and information exchange with the rest of the team, locally and remotely
* Identifying and suggesting any opportunities to provide a better service
* Participating in a regular weekend working rotation


**What we are looking for in you**
* Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path. Preferable majors: Computer Science, MIS, Electrical Engineering, etc.
* Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
